293552110.Name: Virtual Open Coffee Club
293552110.Long Description:
Free Event. Hosted by Santa Monica New Tech / Los Angeles
NEW: Click here for your membership and a downloadable resource pack for entrepreneurs!
This is a virtual meeting on Zoom. Watch for the meeting ID and passcode after you RSVP.
VIDEO CONFERENCE DETAILS:
London Time: 18:00-19:00 Introductions on Zoom. 19:00-20:00 Informal Networking using Zoom breakout rooms or other channels.
You can download the Zoom client ahead of time at https://zoom.us/download#client_4meeting. I recommend you familiarize yourself with the Zoom app if you've never used it before. Here are some helpful tutorials: https://bit.ly/3alN4NV.
A few things to prepare:
• You should check in about 10 minutes early to make sure you can connect and your audio and video are working right.
• To handle introductions, you will be called on when it's your turn to introduce yourself. A microphone will be required for us to hear you. If you choose computer audio please make sure yours is set up and working with Zoom — there is a test function within the app.
• Having your own camera and having it on is required.
• Admissions close 10 minutes past the hour to avoid disrupting the meeting in progress.
• By default, you will be muted at the start. You can unmute yourself when it’s your turn to speak. Please mute yourself again afterward to avoid disruptions to the meeting.
• Once we are done with the introductions we'll have some themed breakout rooms (tech, sales/marketing, legal, finance, other) for networking.
• IMPORTANT: If you'd like to connect with other participants after the session by using the messaging feature in Meetup make sure to change your Privacy Settings to allow being contacted by other members.
TRADITIONAL COFFEE SHOP MEETING DETAILS:
10AM-11AM Introductions. 11AM-12PM Informal Networking.
Watch a short video here: https://youtu.be/f42n5a92zy0
The OpenCoffee Club is a concept that originated in London with the goal to encourage entrepreneurs, developers, and investors to organize real-world informal meetups to chat, network, and grow. There are now hundreds (thousands?) of such groups around the world. Come join the movement!
Learn more about the OCC concept here: https://bit.ly/2MuyURs

293816705.Name: eXponential Finance Live: Next generation market making with Swaap
293816705.Long Description:
Swaap's mission is to democratize DeFi because it is intrinsically better than the centralized financial system. Swaap does so by providing profitable & passive market making strategies to all types of investors, no matter their level of sophistication and by providing traders with the cheapest prices onchain.
By enabling multi-asset pools with strongly reduced impermanent loss, Swaap enables a new asset class: yield ETFs (index products that collect fees). Since Swaap leverages oracle feeds to implement its approach, Swaap is complementary to traditional AMMs and to Order Books:
- AMMs are probably the best design to trade low cap tokens which could not be listed on Order Books.
- Swaap is a more efficient model to invest & trade on-chain for higher cap tokens which are listed on Order Books.
Recently, Swaap Labs has successfully closed a USD 4.5m seed funding round led by Signature Ventures, alongside New Form Capital, C² Ventures, Kima Ventures, Pareto Ventures, Entrepreneur First and other prominent investors.
This funding will accelerate the development and release of Swaap v2, a revolutionary upgrade to Swaap's Next-Generation Market Making Protocol by offering Liquidity Providers LPs passive, profitable market-making strategies with reduced trading costs and sustainable yields.
🔜 Join the waitlist for the upcoming v2 release to access the new platform and enjoy exclusive benefits: swaap.finance/waitlist
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Please subscribe to our weekly LinkedIn newsletter, the "Japan FinTech Observer", at the following link: https://lnkd.in/gNjUuSxG
-------------------------------------------------------------------
You can also find us on:
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/tokyofintech/
Podcast: https://anchor.fm/exponentialfinance
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/tokyofintech
Medium: https://medium.com/tokyo-fintech

292600049.Name: BA 6.1 – Sprints aren't just for agile!
292600049.Tags: Agile Project Management,UI/UX Design,Small Business,Scrum,Design Sprint
292600049.Long Description:
"Sprints aren't just for Agile: The Design Sprint mindset and what it can do for your business"
You’re probably familiar with Agile “sprints”, and you might have heard the term “sprint” being used in other ways all over the business world. So what are Design Sprints really? And what’s the difference from Agile sprints?
Made popular by Google Ventures, Design Sprints and other spin-offs like the Vision Sprint are used by the most innovative companies in the world. Our two guest speakers Mark Garner and Dee Scarano run sprints for startups and large corporations across industries that range from agriculture in Brazil, to IT infrastructure in Africa, to manufacturing in the United States.
Mark and Dee will focus their talk on the Design Sprint and the Vision Sprint, showing us how they work and why they are such an effective tool (and mindset) for businesses to find strategic clarity, de-risk innovation, and achieve success faster.
About our speakers:
Mark Garner is a strategic design consultant who was an early adopter of Google’s GV Design Sprint Process. He has been working globally, facilitating, training and speaking about the process since 2016. Recently, Mark has been running strategic design workshops and helping startups and corporations to ideate, prototype, and test new company visions using an adapted Design Sprint process.
https://visioning.work
https://www.linkedin.com/in/mark-ej-garner/
Dee Scarano consults and coaches startups and large corporations across the globe in product strategy, innovation methods, and rapid validation of business ideas. She’s a world leader in Design Sprint facilitation and has trained teams and lead innovation at organizations such as Google, Twitter, LEGO, Microsoft, Tetra Pak, Lufthansa, Verizon, and many more.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/deescarano/
Your Co-Hosts for the Evening:
Rachel Dickstein: Rachel is an Agile coach and Scrum Master. She is extremely enthusiastic about the world of New Work as well as intercultural communication optimization. You can connect with her on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachel-dickstein-internationalagile/
Petya Ilieva: Petya is a Business Agility Consultant, Organizational Developer, Community Co-Leader at the Business Agility Institute & an Agile Coach at Digital Service GmbH. You can connect with her on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/petya-ilieva-she-her-b28b07146/

293610799.Name: Learnings from Building a Fast-Growing Edtech Startup
293610799.Long Description:
Good product management practices enable startups to build and deliver awesome products. At this practical webinar, learn the latest tools and techniques that your company can use to develop a first-class tech solution. Our guest speaker, Sefunmi Osinaike, comes from a product management background in large companies like Apple and Microsoft, but is now building his own edtech startup, which taught him tons of real-life lessons. Join us to hear his personal hands-on experience, ask questions, and network with other entrepreneurs.
❯ What You'll Learn:
How to map out lean product management strategy
How to use data to test and develop your product
How to collaborate with designers, software engineers, and marketers efficiently
❯ Featured Speakers:
Sefunmi Osinaike - Co-founder at Co.Lab: Sefunmi, Forbes 30 Under 30, is the Co-Founder of Co.Lab, an online school that empowers and prepares career switchers for success within the tech industry. Co.Lab specializes in facilitating collaborative, hands-on product development experience for product managers, designers, and software engineers to gain real-world experience. Sefunmi, who started his career as a product manager at companies such as Apple and Microsoft, is also the author of How to Product—a book on transitioning into product management from outside the industry.
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16473 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293809121.Name: Pitch Lounge: Practice Pitching Your Business Idea to Startup Experts
293809121.Long Description:
Get actionable, instant feedback on your startup
To launch a great startup, it is critical to get feedback on your ideas from entrepreneurs who have been there and done that. First, you'll learn the best practices for creating a concise and compelling elevator pitch. Then, you will have the opportunity to share your pitch with other entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors at virtual tables for instant feedback. Even if you don't want to share your pitch, you can still join to hear other startup ideas and witness how the experts review a pitch.
❯ What You'll Learn:
How to give a concise yet compelling elevator pitch
What investors are looking for in a startup pitch
Specific advice and feedback on your pitch and startup ideas
❯ To get the most out of this Pitch for Feedback event:
Come ready for live video networking
Prepare by starting with your one-sentence pitch. See how it's done using our Madlibs format
Fill out our Elevator Pitch Worksheet
To access all of the networking features of this event, please join using Chrome or Firefox from a desktop or tablet, or download the Airmeet Mobile App.
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16215 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293547065.Name: StartupBlink's Global Startup Ecosystem Index 2023 Launch Event
293547065.Long Description:
Join us for the highly anticipated launch event of StartupBlink's Global Startup Ecosystem Index 2023 (GSEI2023) on May 30th, 2023. This online event will take place in two sessions, providing attendees from around the world the opportunity to participate at their convenience. The first session will begin at 9 AM CET, followed by the second session at 4 PM CET.
Why Join?
Be the first to get the live results of the 2023 Startup Ecosystem Index ranking the ecosystems of 1000 cities and 100 countries
Listen to pitches by over 20 governments introducing their startup ecosystems to the world.
Understand the critical metrics and indicators that shape the success of present-day startup ecosystems.
Agenda for Morning & Afternoon Sessions:
Introduction
Key Insights from StartupBlink's GSEI2023
Overview of the ranking methodology and factors influencing the rankings
Ecosystem pitches: Over 20 stakeholders presenting their startup ecosystems.
Register Now using https://bit.ly/3LXV9wr

293449091.Long Description:
(In-Person Event )
Dear Friends, colleagues, and fellow technologists,
I would like to invite you to our next AI event focused on tales from the startup ecosystem on developing AI in Berlin.
Get ready to immerse yourself in the buzzing heart of Berlin's thriving AI and startup scene! Join us for an exhilarating and unforgettable event. We're bringing together the brightest minds, the most innovative startups, and the most curious enthusiasts.
We will update the speakers soon, but we've got a jam-packed agenda that promises to keep you hooked from the start to finish.
For the community:
Please contact Soraya Maan on LinkedIn to talk about future topics for the meetup, and collaborations or to recommend speakers.
Contact Mario Savovski for pitching in our community round.
Looking forward to seeing you all there.

We'll also feature an inspiring keynote presentation from a top global entrepreneur or investor. Stay after the pitches to network and connect with the hundreds of international founders, investors, advisors, and executives in attendance!

Angel and early-stage investors looking to invest in startups

Founder Showcase is hosted by HubSpot for Startups
HubSpot for Startups empowers startups to achieve unprecedented growth and accelerate scaling with a startup-friendly pricing plan of up to 90% off on essential tools needed to boost lead generation, supercharge sales, and streamline customer service. With the HubSpot Growth Platform, startups can leverage world-class software, cutting-edge educational resources, and powerful integrations to acquire and retain more customers than ever before.

292379737.Name: EP5: Startup Story Time I Softools
292379737.Tags: Open Source,New Technology,Cloud Computing,Web Development,Artificial Intelligence
292379737.Long Description:
Welcome to Startup Story Time! Our bi-weekly event series hosted by Liam Hampton, featuring Microsoft for Startup founders who are excited to share their stories. Each episode in this series, we will be inviting a new founder onto the show to discuss their journey, the products and services they use day-to-day, what gets them to tick and some of the challenges they have faced along the way.
Join us every other Wednesday @ 12pm GMT to learn from the experiences of successful entrepreneurs and gain valuable insights into starting your own business.
In this episode, we chat with Vipul Lakhani, CCO & Tom Dutton, CTO of Softools.
Softools is a powerful, secure and scalable enterprise grade zero code web application for business process digitisation. People without IT skills can learn to create digital solutions in hours and build in minutes. Features include workflow, data security mobile/tablet/PC, reports/dashboards and API Integration with AI services.
Tom will also build a simple application live and demonstrate an Expenses app that has visual recognition services integrated into it for populating information from a receipt and an application for Incident Management / Ideas Management that integrate AI services in their process.

292425989.Name: EP6: Startup Story Time I Mevitae
292425989.Tags: Open Source,New Technology,Cloud Computing,Web Development,Artificial Intelligence
292425989.Long Description:
Welcome to Startup Story Time! Our bi-weekly event series hosted by Liam Hampton, featuring Microsoft for Startup founders who are excited to share their stories. Each episode in this series, we will be inviting a new founder onto the show to discuss their journey, the products and services they use day-to-day, what gets them to tick and some of the challenges they have faced along the way.
Join us every other Wednesday @ 12pm GMT to learn from the experiences of successful entrepreneurs and gain valuable insights into starting your own business.
In this episode, we chat with Riham Satti, Founder of Mevitae
MeVitae is a company that was founded in 2014 and is dedicated to developing innovative and award-winning technologies to help HR and D&I professionals to make smarter, faster, and fairer hiring decisions, whilst mitigating cognitive and algorithmic biases. MeVitae's solutions have been used by a global organizations across various sectors, including the public sector, healthcare, and technology. They provide tools and solutions including anonymised recruiting that enable these organizations to address key challenges in the hiring process, such as accessing diverse talent and identifying the right skill sets for future success. To learn more about MeVitae and their offerings, you can visit their website at https://mevitae.com.

293296578.Name: Discover How Experimentation Drives Startup Success at TechDojo
293296578.Long Description: In this talk Laurent and Zsolt will share lessons learned from TechDojo on how experimentation drives startup success. They will share some patterns, key enablers based on real-life experiences.

293492196.Name: How to Cut Product Development Costs by up to 50%!
293492196.Long Description:
This event is organized by TechSpeak.
Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.
This event is FREE to attend!
In order to attend, please register here:
http://www.techspeakforentrepreneurs.com/how-to-cut-product-development-costs-by-up-to-50/?utm=ideatoipo
(Registrants will receive the login info right before the start of the event.)
There is a difference between releasing code and releasing code effectively and efficiently. That difference is having an efficient process
a repeatable way to produce consistent results over and over again.
In this webinar, Nelly Yusupova, a CTO with 18 years of experience, a startup tech advisor, and the founder of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, will share the process she uses to manage teams and projects to deliver projects on time and on budget.
You will learn:
The lean way vs. traditional way of building products
Two money saving things you should do before you build anything
How to define your MVP properly to reduce the cost and time of development
How to see the red flags sooner and minimize mistakes
and more!
Please come with your questions and scenarios.
About the Speaker
Nelly Yusupova is a CTO, with over 18 years experience, leading companies to technical excellence. She is a startup tech advisor, outsourced CTO, and the creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs.
Nelly is on a mission to help entrepreneurs minimize technology mistakes. Through her online master class TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, she provides the roadmap to successfully manage technology teams and projects.
Just recently included in Fast Company’s, “League of Extraordinary Women”, Nelly has been at the forefront of the women’ s movement online since 1999 and is one of the Wall Street Journal’s “Women on the IT Fast Track”.
Nelly is a speaker and presenter for many organizations and major industries events including: Women’s Enterprise Center, New York Entrepreneurs Business Network, Small Business Summit, BlogHer, Social Media Jungle, Mom 2.0, BlogWorld, and more.
She has been featured in Inc. Magazine, NBC's Today Show, Fast Company, NewsDay.com, O’Reilly, Smart Money, Small Biz, TechRepublic, Women’s Radio and more.
Nelly can be reached at:
nelly@techspeak.co

How to define your MVP properly to reduce the cost and time of development
How to see the red flags sooner and minimize mistakes
and more!
Please come with your questions and scenarios.
About the Speaker
Nelly Yusupova is a CTO, with over 18 years experience, leading companies to technical excellence. She is a startup tech advisor, outsourced CTO, and the creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs.
Nelly is on a mission to help entrepreneurs minimize technology mistakes. Through her online master class TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, she provides the roadmap to successfully manage technology teams and projects.
Just recently included in Fast Company’s, “League of Extraordinary Women”, Nelly has been at the forefront of the women’ s movement online since 1999 and is one of the Wall Street Journal’s “Women on the IT Fast Track”.
Nelly is a speaker and presenter for many organizations and major industries events including: Women’s Enterprise Center, New York Entrepreneurs Business Network, Small Business Summit, BlogHer, Social Media Jungle, Mom 2.0, BlogWorld, and more.
She has been featured in Inc. Magazine, NBC's Today Show, Fast Company, NewsDay.com, O’Reilly, Smart Money, Small Biz, TechRepublic, Women’s Radio and more.
Nelly can be reached at:
nelly@techspeak.co

293463377.Name: Co-Founder Networking: Find a Business Partner, Online
293463377.Tags: New Technology,Business Strategy,Entrepreneur Networking,Small Business,Web Technology
293463377.Long Description:
One of the most difficult yet important steps in founding a startup is building a great Co-founder team. While many founders may start alone, there are multiple benefits of having a Co-founder, and taking the time to establish a quality team can mean the difference between failure and success. Join us for this fun and interactive online event in Silicon Valley where you will learn best practices for finding and formalizing a Co-founder. In addition, you will have the opportunity to network with others looking for a Co-founder through fun group networking, and one-to-one sessions.
It is not required, but to get the most out of this co-founder networking event, we recommend that you come ready for live video networking and prepare by visiting our Guide to Find a Co-Founder . You can also use this Co-Founder Networking Worksheet prior to joining the event.
To access all of the networking features of this webinar, please join using Chrome or Firefox from a desktop or tablet, or download the Airmeet Mobile App.
❯ Who Should Attend
Anyone who is launching or thinking about launching a Silicon Valley startup
Anyone looking for a co-founder and/or looking to learn about building a co-founder relationship
Anyone interested in finding opportunities with startups
❯ What is the Agenda
Introduction
Short presentation on best practices for finding and formalizing a Co-founder
Group and one-to-one speed networking with others looking for a Co-founder
❯ What Will You Accomplish
Meet startup enthusiasts and experts from around the world
Shortlist individuals that can be a Co-founder
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16190 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293734272.Name: Umsetzung eines skalierbaren E-Commerce-MVP – Lessons Learned & Best Practices
293734272.Long Description:
In den vergangenen Jahren hat E-Commerce einen regelrechten Boom erlebt. Es braucht nicht die Größe eines Zalando oder About You, um seinen eigenen Online-Store umzusetzen. Jedes Unternehmen hat hierbei seine ganz eigenen, individuellen Anforderungen, sodass anfänglich einfache Lösungen schnell zum Hindernis werden.
Zudem können E-Commerce-Solutions sehr komplex werden. Es existieren unzählige Anbieter am Markt und scheinbar endlose Möglichkeiten und Features. Das führt zu diversen Risiken bei der Umsetzung eines Shops und zu Integrationsfragen von der Logistik bis zum ERP.
In dieser Teatime geben wir Einblicke, wie prepend innerhalb von sechs Wochen einen skalierbaren E-Commerce-MVP entwickelt und veröffentlicht hat und diesen iterativ verbesserte.
Schauen Sie gerne auf einen gemeinsamen virtuellen Tee vorbei.
⏰ Datum & Uhrzeit
Mittwoch, der 14. Juni von 15:30 Uhr - 16:15 Uhr
📍Location
Remote via Zoom – die URL erhalten Sie nach der Registrierung bei Meetup.
🗣️ Speaker
Dennis Kluge, Geschäftsführer & Principal Consultant

293303909.Tags: SEO (Search Engine Optimization),Content Strategy,Natural Language Processing,Content Management,AI Algorithms
293303909.Long Description:

In this series of meetups, we will try to stay away from the hyped topics and focus on concrete, actionable, ideas, tools, and processes, to simplify the life of SEO & Content professionals and help them achieve success.
To do this, in the frame of Omio’s picturesque office with a view on the Berlin skyline and a beautiful rooftop, we have invited 3 prominent speakers to join us for an evening full of learnings, discussions and networking, all over some drinks and food! (All talks will be followed by a Q&A).

293564638.Name: Uncovering Salary Predictions in the German Job Market (Limited Spaces!)
293564638.Long Description:
Details:
After a long break, we're excited to announce our next WiDSML meetup! Join us on June 8th at 6:00 PM for an evening of insightful talks and networking opportunities.
Talk Outline:
Our featured speaker for the evening is Klea Sanka, a data scientist at StepStone. She will be presenting on "Uncovering Salary: The Science of Salary Predictions". During her talk, Klea will discuss the salary landscape in the German job market, the issues with data collection and approaches, how to get just the right features, pipeline end-to-end process, keeping track of metrics and automation processes, as well as the challenges we face with gender bias, data representation, and monotonicity in our predictions.
About the Speaker:
Klea Sanka is a Data Scientist at StepStone, where she works on developing data-driven solutions to solve human problems. She has a background in computer and software engineering and enjoys working in teams with people with diverse backgrounds. In her free time, she indulges in her hobbies, including playing Nintendo games, watching anime, exploring the mysteries of astro/physics, and enjoying a good plate of pasta.
Event Agenda:
6:00 PM - Doors open, networking
6:30 PM - Introduction to WiMLDS
6:40 PM - Opening words from Dini Martini, Chief Architect at Stepstone
6:50 PM - Keynote talk by Klea Sanka on "Uncovering Salary: The Science of Salary Predictions"
7:50 PM - Open mic
8:00 PM - Networking with drinks & pizza (optional office tour for interested participants)
Location:
The event will be held at StepStone Gmbh Am Postbahnhof 17, 3rd floor, 10243 Berlin
RSVP:
Secure your spot for the event by completing the registration form through this Google form: https://forms.gle/o9HyrKuqfEne4DnK6.
Please submit your form no later than June 7, 2023, to guarantee your attendance.
Due to limited capacity, participation is capped at 30 individuals. We encourage and prioritize applications from women and people of marginalized genders to promote diversity and inclusivity within the event.
We eagerly anticipate your presence and can't wait to see you there!

293801843.Long Description:
Celebrating the new look of Circles Coop while making our work more visible worldwide: From Berlin to the global communities!
Join us for the assembly and community market if you are in Berlin! We will have live music, delicious food, and local market by the Belin pilot businesses and the community.
Our market will be open to the whole community to bring their products and services for CRC. We will have fresh produce, crafts, books, and many other services offered by our business partners as part of our Berlin Pilot.
WHEN:
June 7th, 18:00-20:00 pm
SCHEDULE:
▻ 18 -19.30h Community Market & Assembly - Celebrating the new look of our Circles Coop, along with live music, delicious food, and local market by the Belin pilot businesses and the community.
▻ 19.30h Networking
LOCATION:
Bauhütte Kreuzberg e.V.
Friedrichstraße 19
10969 Berlin, Germany
Join the Berlin Bazaar chat:
https://t.me/CirclesBazaar
If you're not in the system yet and want to start using Circles in Berlin please go to https://circles.garden and create a wallet!
What is Circles?
Circles is a community currency which aims at creating an unconditional basic income from the bottom-up, allowing people, cooperatives, businesses and communities to exchange with each other the things that they need for the resources available in the region. You can read more here joincircles.net and here handbook.joincircles.net .
The Circles Coop Team facilitates Assemblies for people and groups to come together and democratically organise the economy in Berlin. Circles is only one side of the coin, the aim is to create the social organisation which supports the local economy with the principles of decentralization, localism, sustainability and democratic confederation, in order to bring about real-viable economic and political alternatives to our current problems
P.S. With your appearance, the agreement for the admission, storage and publication of pictorial material in the context of the press and public work are connected. If you don't want to appear in the photos, please let us know, or stay in the background, to let us make documentation.

293638639.Name: Successful Stock Market Investing: An Introduction
293638639.Long Description:
In light of the current cost of living crisis, rising inflation and interest rates, and the potential for a recession, the present time is an excellent opportunity to cultivate new skills. In times of record-high inflation, it becomes crucial to safeguard oneself from its impact. How are you ensuring your financial protection amidst these challenges?
Are you interested in acquiring knowledge on capitalizing on lower stock prices?
Have you incurred losses from trading in the stock market?
Do you have funds sitting idly in a bank account, earning minimal interest?
Is your pension planning falling behind?
Are you concerned about the fluctuating market's effect on your pension?
Do you desire a greater understanding of financial matters?
Is there a looming possibility of another significant financial and stock market collapse? Understanding how to safeguard your wealth and navigate through a financial crisis has never been more crucial than now.
We are now well into 2023 and there are many opportunities for those who possess the knowledge and expertise so it is essential to equip yourself with the necessary skills to not only survive but also thrive during such challenging times.
The fact that numerous individuals who have amassed great wealth, such as Warren Buffett, Jeff Bezos, and Ray Dalio, have done so through the stock market is not a mere coincidence. In this crucial presentation, Jonathan Horrocks, your host, will provide an introductory insight into stock market investing. The presentation will cover the following key topics:
The reasons why you should contemplate investing in the stock market.
Why the present moment is an opportune time to initiate your learning journey about the stock market.
Understanding the pk management strategies.
Significant secret to consistently outperforming the market
Emphasizing the importance of simplicity in investing.
Techniques for building long-term wealth and safeguarding against market crashes.
By delving into these subjects, you will gain valuable knowledge to make informed decisions in stock market investing and secure your financial future.
Join Jonathan Horrocks, a seasoned Chartered Accountant with over 45 years of experience in stock market investing and over 10 years of closely following the markets. Jonathan has trained with some of the top investors in the world and loves to teach which shows in his enthusiasm for the subject as you will see when you attend this presentation.
Register now and we look forward to seeing you on the call.
Wednesday, June 21, 2023 at 7:00 PM BST

Product-market fit is one of the most important Lean Startup concepts, yet it is also one of the least well defined.
Join us for a FREE online masterclass, where Nelly Yusupova, CTO with 18 years experience, Startup Tech Advisor, and creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, will share what is product market fit and the importance of reaching product market fit quickly.

And more!
About the Speaker
Nelly Yusupova is a CTO, with over 18 years experience, leading companies to technical excellence. She is a start-up tech advisor, outsourced CTO, and the creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs.
Nelly is on a mission to help entrepreneurs minimize technology mistakes and through her online masterclass TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, she provides the roadmap to successfully manage technology teams and projects.
Just recently included in Fast Company’s, “League of Extraordinary Women”, Nelly has been at the forefront of the women’ s movement online since 1999 and is a Wall Street Journal’s “Woman on the IT Fast Track”.
Nelly is a speaker and presenter for many organizations and major industries events including: Women’s Enterprise Center, NY Entrepreneurs Business Network, Small Business Summit, BlogHer, Social Media Jungle, Mom 2.0, BlogWorld, and has been featured in INC Magazine, NBC Today Show, Fast Company Magazine, NewsDay.com, O’Reilly, SmartMoney, SmallBiz, TechRepublic, Women’s Radio.

293492739.Name: Digital Transformation Enabling the Biopharma of the Future
293492739.Tags: Social Media Marketing,Digital Media,SEO (Search Engine Optimization),Women in Technology,Digital Marketing
293492739.Long Description:
How is digital transformation shaping the Biopharma industry? How is one of the most regulated industries in the world due to the complexity of GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) regulations driving digital transformation?
Register on the WDS website to receive the zoom link: https://www.womenindigitalswitzerland.com/event-details/digital-transformation-enabling-the-biopharma-of-the-future
Join us online to understand more about the impact of digital transformation in the pharmaceutical industry and how CSL is navigating through the digitalization journey in a way that complies with regulations. Our esteemed speakers from CSL Behring and CSL Vifor will share their personal career journeys, insights, and experiences, highlighting the unique opportunities and challenges of working at the forefront of digital transformation in the biopharma sector. From R&D, and Regulatory Affairs to workforce training, you will also gain valuable insights into the various career paths that exist in the digital biopharma landscape. Through short presentations, interactive discussions, and Q&A sessions, you'll have the chance to connect with CSL professionals who are leading the way in leveraging digital technologies to drive innovation in the biopharmaceutical industry.
(Computational) Biochemist by background, Tamara has been working at CSL Behring for the last 5 years as Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) Manager within its Recombinant and Gene Therapy portfolio. She is deeply passionate about data-driven opportunities and modernizing RA by using digital technologies, to accelerate time to market and patients’ access to innovative therapies. She holds an MBA in Technology and Innovation Management, and has broad experience with digitalization initiatives across pharma industry leaders. Tamara is a keen supporter of women in STEM and Digital. She lectures and mentors on topics of RA Digital Transformation at Bern University of Applied Sciences.
Carmen holds a Ph.D. in Biochemistry from ETH Zürich. During her studies, she focused on automation and digital innovation. In her research, she analyses genetic, proteomic, and lipidomic screens as well as advanced image analysis such as single particle tracking. She has been working in the field of R&D and Global Regulatory Affairs and was involved in different projects to standardize and simplify processes by automation. Carmen believes digital transformation is key to providing the best support to patients in the future.
Barbara has extensive experience in the pharmaceutical industry, spanning over 18 years, and has a proven track record of success in clinical study management, global medical affairs, product management and global pharmaceutical training. Additionally, she possesses excellent digital skills, including experience in developing blended training journey including e-learning and mobile learning tools, which highlights her ability to adapt to the ever-changing digital landscape. Nowadays, she’s in charge of developing strategies, plans and approaches to develop CSL Vifor capabilities in marketing, sales and disease/product knowledge. Barbara is an effective change agent, able to work both independently and collaboratively to promote a positive and productive environment, making her an ideal choice for any event that requires an industry expert with extensive digital skills and a proven ability to drive change.
CSL Behring is a global biotechnology leader, driven by that same promise to save and improve lives. They offer the broadest range of quality plasma-derived and recombinant therapies in the industry. Sponsoring our activities and digital events.
Moderated by Dr. Andrea Rubik, seasoned marketer and founder of Resyfy. She has experience building brands and products, digital marketing, and business development, working with SaaS and tech companies. Andrea has devoted her career to supporting women and collaborating around advancing equality in tech, crafting initiatives to help women to revive their career valuables and reach the next level in their careers.
WDS is a community of modern leaders who leverage collaboration and elevate diversity to advance careers and create business opportunities in the Swiss digital economy. By leveraging the power of our community, Women in Digital Switzerland (WDS) advances careers, supports organizational transformation leaps, and creates business opportunities in the Swiss digital economy and beyond. Be part of the change. Become a member.

293759773.Name: Chart Your Course | From Goals to Growth Marketing Strategies
293759773.Long Description:
The event link will be announced soon!
Are you ready to take your business growth to the next level? Do you have your goals clearly defined and wonder what the next steps are? Then you're in the right place! Join us for our upcoming webinar, "Chart Your Course: From Goals to Growth Marketing Strategies."
In this interactive session, we'll navigate together through the waters of growth marketing. Our guide, Ben Sufiani, founder of Pirate Skills, will steer us into the practical strategies and tactics that transform well-defined goals into impactful results.
Together, we'll discover how to:
Uncover key areas of potential breakthroughs for your business.
Translate your ideas into a solid, actionable growth marketing strategy.
But this isn't a journey we'll embark on alone. As part of the Pirate Skills community, we'll be sailing alongside other startup founders and marketers, all of whom bring unique insights and experiences.
We'll use the case study of "Pirate Bills," our fictional SaaS business, to anchor our discussions with practical examples. This isn't just a passive lecture – it's an active discussion where your questions, insights, and ideas are welcome and encouraged.
Whether your company operates in the SaaS, E-commerce, or digital products realm, this webinar will provide the navigational tools to steer your business toward more significant impact and profitability. As a bonus, all participants will receive a free Growth Opportunity Checklist – a practical tool to help identify your next steps.
Take advantage of this opportunity to come aboard and join a crew of like-minded professionals, all working together to navigate the seas of business growth.
Chart your course with Pirate Skills, and let's set sail toward success together!

293610798.Name: Learnings from Building a Fast-Growing Edtech Startup
293610798.Long Description:
Good product management practices enable startups to build and deliver awesome products. At this practical webinar, learn the latest tools and techniques that your company can use to develop a first-class tech solution. Our guest speaker, Sefunmi Osinaike, comes from a product management background in large companies like Apple and Microsoft, but is now building his own edtech startup, which taught him tons of real-life lessons. Join us to hear his personal hands-on experience, ask questions, and network with other entrepreneurs.
❯ What You'll Learn:
How to map out lean product management strategy
How to use data to test and develop your product
How to collaborate with designers, software engineers, and marketers efficiently
❯ Featured Speakers:
Sefunmi Osinaike - Co-founder at Co.Lab: Sefunmi, Forbes 30 Under 30, is the Co-Founder of Co.Lab, an online school that empowers and prepares career switchers for success within the tech industry. Co.Lab specializes in facilitating collaborative, hands-on product development experience for product managers, designers, and software engineers to gain real-world experience. Sefunmi, who started his career as a product manager at companies such as Apple and Microsoft, is also the author of How to Product—a book on transitioning into product management from outside the industry.
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16473 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293809116.Name: Pitch Lounge: Practice Pitching Your Business Idea to Startup Experts
293809116.Long Description:
Get actionable, instant feedback on your startup
To launch a great startup, it is critical to get feedback on your ideas from entrepreneurs who have been there and done that. First, you'll learn the best practices for creating a concise and compelling elevator pitch. Then, you will have the opportunity to share your pitch with other entrepreneurs, advisors, and investors at virtual tables for instant feedback. Even if you don't want to share your pitch, you can still join to hear other startup ideas and witness how the experts review a pitch.
❯ What You'll Learn:
How to give a concise yet compelling elevator pitch
What investors are looking for in a startup pitch
Specific advice and feedback on your pitch and startup ideas
❯ To get the most out of this Pitch for Feedback event:
Come ready for live video networking
Prepare by starting with your one-sentence pitch. See how it's done using our Madlibs format
Fill out our Elevator Pitch Worksheet
To access all of the networking features of this event, please join using Chrome or Firefox from a desktop or tablet, or download the Airmeet Mobile App.
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16215 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293463366.Name: Co-Founder Networking: Find a Business Partner, Online
293463366.Long Description:
One of the most difficult yet important steps in founding a startup is building a great Co-founder team. While many founders may start alone, there are multiple benefits of having a Co-founder, and taking the time to establish a quality team can mean the difference between failure and success. Join us for this fun and interactive online event in Silicon Valley where you will learn best practices for finding and formalizing a Co-founder. In addition, you will have the opportunity to network with others looking for a Co-founder through fun group networking, and one-to-one sessions.
It is not required, but to get the most out of this co-founder networking event, we recommend that you come ready for live video networking and prepare by visiting our Guide to Find a Co-Founder . You can also use this Co-Founder Networking Worksheet prior to joining the event.
To access all of the networking features of this webinar, please join using Chrome or Firefox from a desktop or tablet, or download the Airmeet Mobile App.
❯ Who Should Attend
Anyone who is launching or thinking about launching a Silicon Valley startup
Anyone looking for a co-founder and/or looking to learn about building a co-founder relationship
Anyone interested in finding opportunities with startups
❯ What is the Agenda
Introduction
Short presentation on best practices for finding and formalizing a Co-founder
Group and one-to-one speed networking with others looking for a Co-founder
❯ What Will You Accomplish
Meet startup enthusiasts and experts from around the world
Shortlist individuals that can be a Co-founder
❯❯ This is a live, interactive online event, so be sure to RSVP at https://fi.co/startupwebinar/16190 to receive the Zoom URL to join us live!

293389465.Name: Finding Candidate-Market-Fit for Product Managers
293389465.Tags: User Experience,Agile Project Management,Lean Startup,Product Design,Innovation
293389465.Long Description:
Join us for a discussion with the author of Never Search Alone, Phyl Terry, who will be joining us from New York, and Mario Schwarz, a product executive who has been applying the techniques discussed in the book.
In his foreword, Marty Cagan calls Never Search Alone a must-read for anyone thinking about a job search. This new approach to finding the right job focuses on three big ideas learned from helping thousands of job seekers: building community, finding clarity, and taking action.
During this event, Phyl and Mario will share their insights on how both entry-level PMs and senior product executives can apply these techniques to their own job search. You'll learn how to build a strong community of supporters, identify your unique strengths and values, and take action to find the job of your dreams.
The agenda for the event is as follows:
Phyl gives an overview of the key principles of Never Search Alone, including building community, finding clarity, and taking action.
Mario shares his job search story and how he's been applying the techniques from Never Search Alone.
QA with the speakers, where you'll have the opportunity to ask any questions you have about finding the right job and building a successful career.
Join us for this online event and prepare for levelling up your career.
We look forward to seeing you!
Dominique, Tanja & the Product Academy Community Crew

292726274.Name: UX Design: How to create Customer Journey Maps & User Flows
292726274.Tags: User Experience,Lean Startup,UI/UX Design,UX Design,Customer Journey Mapping
292726274.Long Description:
UX Design is a complex process. There are lots of deliverables that may help to create a solution that will be useful and joyful for customers.
Whereas user flows are concerned with single tasks, user journeys encompass the entire experience a user has with your product or service. On the other hand, a sitemap is a file where you provide information about the pages, videos, and other files on your site, and the relationships between them.
In this live event, the Lean Product Innovator & UX Strategist with +13 years of experience and having designed over 50 application, and leader of one of the best UX Design studios in Germany, Bonanza Design, Behrad Mirafshar, will explore:
👉 The differences between User Journey Maps and User Flows? What is their purpose? How they complement each other?
👉 What is a UX sitemap and what are its benefits?
👉 What methods would you use to develop a customer journey and user maps?
👉 Creating a UX sitemap
About the speaker: Behrad Mirafshar
Behrad Mirafshar is the founder and CEO of Bonanza Design GmbH.
Bonanza Design is a rapidly-expanding Innovation Studio with a global team based in Berlin, Germany. 292725791.Name: Lean UX Process: Integrating UX into Agile Development
292725791.Tags: Small Business Marketing Strategy,User Experience,Lean Startup,Innovation,UX Design
292725791.Long Description:
Agile methodologies are most often used by tech teams to ship new features.
Contrary to the conventional approach (waterfall), Agile approach doubles down on the flexibility of tech teams to be responsive to market and customer changes. Not only tech teams, but entire product teams have started adapting their workflows so they can work hand in hand with the dev team.
An agile sprint lasts between one and two weeks on average and offers less wiggle room for UX designers to practice their own design process. That's the source of complaints from many UX Designers.
At this live event, the Lean Product Innovator & UX Strategist with +12 years of experience, and leader of one of the best UX Design studios in Germany, Bonanza Design, Behrad Mirafshar, will break it down for you:
👉 What is Lean UX Process?
👉 The role of designers in a typical agile process
👉 How can UX designers can be effectively incorporated at all stages of Agile development?
About the speaker: Behrad Mirafshar

293690496.Name: Demystifying UX Research: Unraveling its Complexities for Success
293690496.Tags: User Experience,Lean Startup,UI/UX Design,UX Design,Customer Journey Mapping
293690496.Long Description:
In this insightful webinar on UX research featuring renowned expert Nikki Andersen, you will discover the true essence of UX research, breaking the myth of perfection and emphasizing the value of embracing imperfection for personal and professional growth.
You will gain a holistic perspective on validation approaches and learn why negativity and challenges are essential for driving innovation, exploring the pivotal role of a researcher as a catalyst for change, guiding teams towards user-centric design decisions.
Behrad and Nikki will candidly discuss the inevitability of mistakes in user research and their transformative potential.
Whether you're an experienced professional or a newcomer, be inspired to embrace the learning process, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and resilience.
Here we will unravel the complexities of UX research, offering valuable insights to empower and elevate your skills.
Don't miss this opportunity to gain a fresh perspective and join a supportive community that champions growth and collaboration in the field of user research.
About the speakers:
Behrad Mirafshar

Connect with him on LinkedIn
Nikki Anderson
User Research Academy founder and user research coach, Nikki Anderson, is a passionate advocate for user researchers. With a background as a UXR since 2015, Nikki understands the challenges of working as a team of one and the feelings of loneliness and self-doubt that can arise. This motivated her to create a thriving user research community, offering support, empowerment, and a sense of belonging. Through User Research Academy and the membership program, Nikki aims to inspire and empower user researchers, providing them with the tools, knowledge, and confidence to excel in their careers. By fostering a supportive environment, she encourages user researchers to embrace new methods and approaches while having fun and finding fulfillment in their work.

293608278.Name: Speed Networking & AI for B2B Sales
293608278.Tags: Business to Business (B2B),Professional Networking,Speed Networking,Sales,AI and Society
293608278.Long Description:
Unless you have been living in a cave, you have heard about ChatGPT.
H﻿ow can AI tools be used in Sales?
W﻿hat are the common strategies and best practices?
H﻿ow can we leverage the transformative power of AI tools such as ChatGPT and others?
Join us on Monday, June 12th between 18:30-21:00 in St. Oberholz for a special event! An evening dedicated to the theme of AI tools in Sales.
Register here: https://club100-june-oberholz.eventbrite.ie
An event where innovation meets speed networking!
Your opportunity to discuss and share best practices, tools, predictions and make as many connections as possible in a fun, friendly and fast paced environment!
Agenda:
18:30-19:00: Welcome / Check-In
19:00-20:00: "Power hour" - Speed networking with one theme: AI & Sales
20:00-21:00: Socialising, mingling, free networking
The concept:
Speed networking is designed to help you accelerate your business contacts through facilitated introductions and conversations – at speed. We'll rotate all participants so that each person gets the chance to engage 1 on 1 with as many people as possible. For each rotation, you have a set time – generally 5-6 minutes each – to introduce yourself and share best practices about ChatGPT and everything AI for Sales.
Speed Networking for Sales Professionals (free)
Venue: St. Oberholz in Berlin Mitte at Rosenthaler Platz (Rosenthaler Strasse 72A)
St. Oberholz opened in Berlin Mitte in 2005: a creative hub that is now internationally known and is considered a milestone in the history of co-working in Europe. It is located in an historic building and includes a café, co-working spaces, and various conference rooms.
Wide variety of drink options at the bar (beer, wine, coffee, tea, soft drinks)
Web: https://sanktoberholz.coffee/
Nearest Station: U-Rosenthaler Platz (U8). Tram M1 and M8.
Are you in B2B Sales? Are you interested in getting to know other sales people in Berlin, growing your network and making new connections? If yes, this event is for you!
Please no students, no recruiters, and 2 people per company max to allow quality conversations and a chance to meet different people from different companies.
Club 100 is a network of enterprise sales professionals, we organize regular B2B sales events in Berlin, share knowledge and help you learn from others and make new connections! Our events are limited to a small group of people allowing you to have quality conversations in a nice and friendly atmosphere.
F﻿ollow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/76359963
Registration is necessary.
Register here: https://club100-june-oberholz.eventbrite.ie
We will take photos and videos during the event. By registering for the event you agree that your photo or video can be used for event promotional purposes. If you don't want your photo or video to be taken, come to our team during the event.
The Club 100 Team
FAQ:
1. Who is this event for?
In order to maximize the networking opportunity and in the interest of the event, this event is dedicated towards Sales Professionals and Sales Leaders. We limit the attendance to 2 people per company. The theme of our June event will be "AI in Sales".
2. How will I find you?
We have a reserved area for our group. Our organizers will welcome you and show you where we sit. Once registered, we'll also send you further instructions about the venue/our contact details.
3. Can I bring my friend?
We have limited places available, so please make sure to sign up early and register your friend as well.
4. What if I no longer can come?
If for whatever reason you can no longer attend, please inform us in advance (48 hours prior to the event) so we can add someone else from the waitlist. You can cancel your ticket via the app or send us an email to info@club100b2b.com
5. I signed up for the event but I didn't get the confirmation.
If your profile matches, we'll send you the confirmation details with the exact location of the event.
6﻿. What if I can't be there at the beginning?
I﻿f you are late or can't be there for the power hour, you can also join the free networking/mingling, starting at around 20:00.
Event is subject to change.

293731312.Name: Get More Sales With High Converting Websites
293731312.Long Description:
Are you struggling to get your website to convert?
Are you wanting to create a website and don’t know where to start?
Are you struggling to get traffic to your website?
Well, you need to sign up for this webinar now!
Joy Mallard, the founder and CEO of JM Digital Online services, will be hosting a webinar on how to create high-converting websites.
She has spoken on huge platforms for businesses like the Internet Business School which are the leading digital marketing training company in the UK.
During the webinar, Joy will be sharing the latest techniques and strategies for designing websites that convert visitors into customers.
You will learn how to optimize your website for user experience, improve your site's loading speed, and create compelling content that drives conversions.
Additionally, she will be sharing some real-life case studies of websites that have implemented these strategies and achieved remarkable success in terms of lead generation and sales.
You will have the opportunity to see exactly how these principles work in action and learn how you can apply them to your own website.
By the end of the webinar, you will have a clear understanding of how to create a website that not only looks great but also converts visitors into customers.
You will be equipped with the tools and knowledge you need to take your online business to the next level.
So why should you join Joy's webinar?
Well, if you're looking to grow your online business and increase your revenue, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
You will learn from an expert in the field and gain practical knowledge that you can implement right away.
We look forward to seeing you at the webinar and hope to help you achieve your online business goals.
Sign up now as spaces are limited!!
Joy and Sjors

293822569.Name: Learn how to manage money
293822569.Long Description:
Learn simple money tips to get control of your finances, change your money mindset, build wealth and become financially free.
We are living through challenging times - inflation, higher interest rates and economic downturn. Despite this, there are always opportunities and there are always people who do well in any economy.
What can you do to not only survive, but thrive regardless of external events?
What’s going on in your own internal economy, and in your head, will have more influence on your financial success than external events.
Recent events have shown us that when things go wrong, like a job loss or higher bills, most people have no back-up plan or savings to get them through a short term crisis.
Learning to manage your money is the first step towards building wealth and becoming financially free.
In this free live online training, Charles is going to show you how to get control of your finances in 28 days without sacrificing your enjoyment of life.
About Charles Kelly
Speaker, Podcaster, Author, Property Investor, Digital Marketing and Business Consultant.

Helping people achieve financial freedom through training and education, money management and acquiring money making skills

Mathieu is responsible for the market development and sales initiatives in Japan for the sell-side and buy-side client base, with a particular focus on growing the Exchange’s listed products and services offerings in the Asia time zone, and expanding on the usage of the Eurex OTC Interest Rate Derivatives post his contributions to attaining the relevant license in Japan.

How successful entrepreneurs think

Case studies students who have applied the mindset and have generated great results in the process

Anyone wanting to learn how to become financially successful

Come along, learn the type of mindset successful entrepreneurs have, as well as learn how to get started on your road to financial freedom.

293756610.Name: Futura Talks: Unusual CV's - The Unbeaten Path
293756610.Tags: New Career,Women's Business Networking,Professional Networking,Career Coaching,Women Entrepreneurs
293756610.Long Description:
What has your career path looked like? Have you climbed one set of stairs or taken an alternative route?
The more unconventional, non-linear career path, has often been seen as representing an individual who is unable to commit to a role and unsure of what they want. We want to challenge this assumption, we believe that non-linear career paths provide individuals with room to follow their passions and gather new skills and knowledge that help them evolve along the way. Not everyone can go to university or follow a traditional education, this translates into a non-traditional CV which can be unfairly dismissed in recruitment processes – but taking the road less traveled can be just as, if not more valuable than, following the highway.
On Tuesday 6 June, Futura will be exploring what is really important in the ever-changing job market. Is it your ability to adapt and apply your skillset? Or your educational and professional background?
Join Fabiola Da Silva from GoCardless and Susanne Krehl from Fabit as they share their unusual journeys into fintech, and how they overcame (and still overcome) hurdles to achieve their dreams.
About our Speakers
Fabiola Da Silva
Fabiola is Corporate Account Executive at GoCardless, a UK-based fintech that enables financial service businesses to streamline their payments operations.
Fabiola is a natural sales talent and made her career building strong relationships and professional networks. While her professional background is purely commercial, Fabiola studied chemical engineering at the University Simon Bolivar (Venezuela) and innovation and entrepreneurship at the University of Barcelona (Spain).
Susanne Krehl
Susanne, has an academic background in Communication. After working several years as a consultant, she joined the fintech Viafintech (former “Barzahlen), where she went from leading the Marketing and PR team to managing the international expansion of the company.
Susanne founded Fabit in June 2021, and has acted since then as Managing Director. Fabit is an app that helps people with their personal finance and promotes financial well-being.

293827790.Name: Print-on-Demand Success: Discover How To Include AI Technology
293827790.Tags: Personal Development,Social Media Marketing,Starting an Online Business,Building an Online Business,Sales and Marketing Training
293827790.Long Description:
Are you dreaming of starting your own online business but lacking the funds to buy stock or the space to store it? Or maybe you're searching for a business you can run from anywhere, even while travelling, without worrying about making, packing, or shipping products? If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, then print-on-demand is the answer you've been looking for!
Join us for an exciting and informative presentation with Nigel Wymer, a successful business mentor, coach, and print-on-demand specialist. Nigel has over 15 years of experience making a living on the internet and has earned six-figure sums from selling on Etsy, his chosen marketplace for starting a POD business.
In this session, Nigel will reveal the essential steps to setting up a successful print-on-demand business. He will explain why Etsy is the best platform to sell your products, how to build your brand, and provide expert tips on professional shop setup and design, simple SEO, and PPC advertising.
Discover how print-on-demand is predicted to grow by 33% over the next 3 years and how demand for personalized products is expected to rise even higher. And, most importantly, learn how you can start your own online business with practically zero costs and no need for a website, social media, or to drive traffic.
Nigel has several shops on Etsy and will share his experience and expertise on print-on-demand, and reveal why it is probably the best online business model out there today. He will also discuss how he started a brand new print-on-demand shop as a challenge on Etsy selling just mugs and made over 600 sales within 18 weeks, this new shop ranking in the top 8% of performing shops.
Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to learn from Nigel's talent and experience. Places are limited, so register now to secure your spot!
See you there
Gareth

Wir starten mit einem kreative Ice-Breaker zum locker machen und Kennenlernen. Dann gehen wir in Kleingruppen, um uns etwas persönlicher zu derzeit relevanten Themen auszutauschen, z.B. Fördermittel, Team, soziale Medien austauschen.

293585299.Name: From Hierarchy to a Network of Teams
293585299.Tags: Organizational Change Management,Team Building,Scrum in Real World,Agile and Scrum,Enterprise Agility
293585299.Long Description:
When you have been used to doing something one way for any length of time, it can take a lot of work to change, even when the benefits of the new method are clear. In traditional organizations, the management hierarchy makes decisions and the workforce carries them out.
So, transitioning to an organization where decision-making is distributed can be a challenge, both for those giving up their decision-making power and those gaining new responsibilities.
It may also not be entirely clear what the alternative to the Hierarchy could be.
In this webinar, we look at the challenge of making the choice to change, the mechanics of making it happen (including some rookie mistakes) and the benefits that accrue from putting decision-making power into the hands of those with the skills and knowledge to take them.
We will look at how to create an organization with a constitution (a set of commonly accepted agreements). These are an agreed set of constraints and freedoms and a way of making decisions in a representative way.
We will also try to give some practical hints about what each person can do to enable colleagues’ engagement and willingness to participate in decision-making.
The results are healthier organizations, more engaged and committed employees and sustainable customer outcomes.
Join us for this presentation and discussion.

293614877.Long Description:
👉🏻Thinking about changing careers, but not sure how to land a job afterward?
🚨 Watch this on-demand session -> get the link
📝 // What we'll be talking about // 📝
In this webinar, we'll talk about why networking is an essential part of the job search process.
Not only will you have access to more opportunities, but networking can also help you perform better in your interviews so you can land more offers.
Specifically, you'll learn:
The three most deadly interview mistakes that most job seekers make (most of them are not even aware of this)
How to leverage LinkedIn Networking to gain insider information that will 3x your interview success rate.
How to pitch yourself in interviews using my 4-step method so you can portray yourself as a high-quality candidate and land more offers.
🚨 Watch this on-demand session -> get the link

293636782.Name: Monthly Titans Networking Meetup
293636782.Long Description:
With this weekly meetup we want to facilitate creating new collaborations between LGBTQ+ Business Owners.
But it's also a moment where it's possible to ask questions regarding business building that can help you reach the next level.
3 Main Pillars:
Networking: Meet other LGBTQ+ business owners
Pitch: Don't be afraid to talk about your product or service, everyone can give advice/feedback on your current offer
Share: Asking questions and sharing your knowledge is important, together we will grow to the next level!
The whole setup for Titanology is to create a safe space for LGBTQ+ business owners to discover new connections, knowledge and share wins, struggles, advice,...
Please go to https://titanology.world first to join the Titans, so you already know more who you are going to meet.

293353275.Name: Online speedy networking (15-30 Min)
293353275.Long Description:
Hallo zusammen,
Ich freue mich, euch mitteilen zu können, dass unsere Online-Sitzungen künftig alle zwei Wochen stattfinden werden. Vielen Dank an alle, die sich der Gruppe angeschlossen haben. Ich hoffe, dass die geplante Zeit für uns alle passend ist.
Der Zweck des Treffens ist ganz einfach: Bei den Speedy-Networking-Treffen hat jeder Teilnehmer maximal 2 Minuten Zeit, sich vorzustellen. Nach 2 Minuten ertönt der Gong und ein weiterer Teilnehmer wird gebeten, sich vorzustellen. Wenn nach der ganzen Runde der Vorstellung noch keine 20 Minuten vergangen sind, können die Teilnehmer sich einfach abmelden (ohne etwas sagen zu müssen) und über LinkedIn oder andere Medien individuell mit jedem Vorstellenden in Kontakt treten.
Für einen intensiveren Austausch, bei dem man sich besser kennenlernt und mehr Vertrauen gewinnt, werden die Business Hiking Events einmal im Monat organisiert. Derzeit werden die Business Hiking Events nur in der Schweiz organisiert.
Ich freue mich auf die gemeinsamen Events
Beste Grüsse
Frenk
Meeting Angaben für Online:
https://us05web.zoom.us/j/87324440131?pwd=ZExnaHM2SHVvcXVGWkpoQjZGaGg2UT09
Meeting-ID: 873 2444 0131
Kenncode: 3BSvcs
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hello everyone,
I am happy to announce that our online meetings will be held every other week going forward. Thank you to everyone who has joined the group. I hope that the scheduled time is convenient for all of us.
The purpose of the meeting is very simple: at the Speedy Networking meetings, each participant has a maximum of 2 minutes to introduce themselves. After 2 minutes, the gong sounds and another participant is asked to introduce themselves. If 20 minutes have not passed after the entire round of introductions, participants can simply sign off (without having to say anything) and contact each introducer individually via LinkedIn or other media.
For a more intensive exchange, where people get to know each other better and gain more trust, the Business Hiking Events are organized once a month. Currently, the Business Hiking Events are only organized in Switzerland.
I am looking forward to the events together
Best regards
Frenk

293465322.Name: Speed Networking for Life Sciences Tech Professionals
293465322.Long Description:
Are you a life sciences technology professional based in Berlin interested in expanding your network and connecting with other like-minded individuals in the industry?
If yes, then join our speed networking event on Monday, June 26th between 18:30 and 21:00 CEST at the Denizen House in Berlin - Kreuzberg!
>>> Do note that you will need to register via our Eventbrite sign up:
https://lstn-speed-networking-june2023.eventbrite.ie <<<
About our Speed Networking Concept:
Our speed networking events are designed to help you accelerate your business contacts through facilitated introductions and conversations - at speed. Our goal is to provide you with an extremely time-saving and effective way of building your professional contacts.
We'll rotate all participants so that each person gets the chance to engage 1 on 1 with as many people as possible. For each rotation, you have a set time – generally 7-8 minutes each – to introduce yourself and learn more about the other person, making speed networking highly efficient.
To allow you to have quality conversations in a friendly atmosphere, our events are capped to a limited number of participants. Moreover, to get the most out of this format and to maximize your connections, we also limit the participants to 2 people per company.
Agenda:
18:30 - 19:00: Welcome & Check-In
19:00 - 20:00: "Power hour" - Speed networking to make valuable business connections
20:00 - 21:00: Socializing, mingling, networking
About the Venue:
Denizen House is located on the ground floor of the historic Eiswerk on Köpenicker Straße in Kreuzberg. It is a communal place providing work, refreshment, and recreational facilities throughout the day - you can think of it like a living room for the neighborhood. They also offer a wide variety of drink options at the bar such as craft beer, wine, coffee, tea, and soft drinks.
Some Event FAQs:
1. Who is this event for?
Our events are dedicated towards professionals in the life science tech space. We limit the attendance to 2 people per company.
2. How will I find you?
Once registered, you’ll receive further instructions about the venue/our contact details.
3. Can I bring my friend?
We have limited places available, so please make sure to sign up early and register your friend as well.
4. What if I no longer can come?
If for whatever reason you can no longer attend, please inform us in advance (48 hours prior to the event) so we can add someone else from the waitlist. You can cancel your ticket via the app or send us an email to lifesciencestechnetwork@gmail.com
5. I signed up for the event but I didn't get the confirmation.
If your profile matches, we'll send you the confirmation details with the exact location of the event.
6﻿. What if I can't be there at the beginning?
I﻿f you are late or can't be there for the speed networking component of the event, you can also join the free networking/mingling starting at around 20:00. Events are subject to change.
Follow us on LinkedIn:
https://www.linkedin.com/company/life-sciences-tech-network-berlin/
>>> Please remember to register via our Eventbrite sign up:
https://lstn-speed-networking-june2023.eventbrite.ie <<<

Networking For Health IV - We LOVE BioTechs & TechBios. Berlin meets NRW!
This event is only valid if Covid regulations permit. Please check this text here in case some rules suddenly apply.
Please be aware, you are not allowed to enter if you have tested positive for Covid OR if you have flu symptoms. Thanks for your understanding.
We want to meet, know what is new, facilitate connections between organizations working in Biotech (e.g., Pharmaceutical R&D) and TechBio (e.g., AI for drug development). Coorganized by Bayer CID (Pharma Commercial IT & Digital), Bayer BD&L (Business Development & Licensing), Berlin Partner, Campus Berlin-Buch, University of Duisburg-Essen, Bryck. If you work in healthcare, be it as Researcher, Startup, VC, Entrepreneur, Digital, Developer, we want to network with you.

293477346.Name: How to Really Network for Your Job Hunt: Led by an expert Job Hunter& Networker
293477346.Tags: Career Network,Career Services,Professional Networking,Business Referral Networking,Professional Development
293477346.Long Description:
Brought to you by Equipt, your professional development community, to network, learn, and collaborate with professionals and recruiters through live online workshops and events. Here is an example of one of our Events (Lessons from a Google Senior Product Designer)
Access workshops, discord community, recordings, and partner jobs @ JOINEQUIPT.COM/REGISTER
This is a structured presentation & interactive workshop. We'll focus on virtual networking, in particular email, LinkedIn, and cold outreach, in the context of job hunting.
How to Really Network
Achieving career success starts with acknowledging your uniqueness and skills and then applying the right combination of strategy, creativity, and resilience to building relationships. This class will teach you to develop and embrace the right habits and skills to succeed in your career pursuits through networking and taking a strategic approach. We'll focus on virtual networking, in particular email, LinkedIn, and cold outreach.
Facilitated by Hubert Dagbo
Hubert is an entrepreneur and investor with over ten years of experience at Morgan Stanley, Credit Suisse, EY, and private equity fund DPI and as the CEO and co-founder of Equipt. Hubert has consistently obtained exciting career opportunities by building meaningful relationships and networking.

293598929.Name: Real Networking Online: June
293598929.Tags: Small Business Marketing Strategy,Entrepreneurship,Entrepreneur Networking,Startup Businesses,Small Business
293598929.Long Description:
If you're the kind of person who thrives around other people who get it, and you want to exchange referrals and collaborations with awesome like-minded people, this is the networking event you need.
Join us online and enjoy unusually good conversations with like-minded business owners: the kind where you laugh, connect, share the best of what you do, and come away inspired.
Imagine an event where business networking meets authenticity. The kind of community and inspiration that leave you feeling fired up about your business. Less cold prospecting and more warm referrals. Less glazed-over eyes and more genuine curiosity. Follow-ups that actually excite you.
Avoid the pitch-fest. Make real connections. Grow your business.
What our attendees say:
· “The most fun I’ve ever had networking.”
· “Amazing conversations!”
· “A well organized and great way to meet people who are going places in their lives.”
· “I love the unique approach.”
· “Incredible group of supportive people who are full of passion and enthusiasm.”
When you attend Real Networking, you become part of a rapidly growing international networking community. Our signature style of networking has been adopted by over a hundred groups in five countries.
Whether you've been in business for years or are just starting out, drop in and join this diverse group of entrepreneurs dedicated to serving our clients with authenticity and helping each other grow our businesses.

293343154.Name: Reviving the group: Let's talk AI over networking and food on June 23rd
293343154.Long Description:
Hello :)
How are you? It's been a very long time...
Are you interested in the fascinating world of AI and its potential applications? Do you want to network with like-minded individuals and enjoy some delicious food while discussing the topic?
Then mark your calendar for June 23rd, because we've got something special in store for you.
We're inviting you to our office and garden located in Puschkinallee 39 (in Treptower Park) for an informal gathering to discuss the latest advancements in AI (text, voice, images). We hope to bring back the "localization meetup group" together and an opportunity to exchange ideas and insights with individuals who share your interests, all while enjoying some mouth-watering treats and refreshing beverages.
At Altagram & Alocai, we believe that AI (and LLM) has the potential to transform various industries and sectors, and we're excited about exploring the different ways in which it can be applied to solve complex challenges in localization. We also recognize that the development of LLM technology should be done with ethical considerations and a deep understanding of its potential impact on society. Through this event, we hope to foster a community of individuals who share our passion for AI and are committed to advancing the field in a responsible and sustainable manner, regardless of their backgrounds or experience levels.
So, if you're interested in attending, all you need to do is RSVP by the 9th of June. We'll take care of the rest, including providing the venue, food, and drinks. All you need to bring is your curiosity and a willingness to engage in thought-provoking discussions.
We look forward to meeting you on June 23rd from 6pm!
Best regards,
Marie and the Altagram/Alocai Teams
mamigues@altagram.com

293531709.Name: [Online] Find a Friend in London - Networking event
293531709.Long Description:
This is an online networking event to make new friends with whom you can pursue your hobby or passion by collaborating once you get to know each other.
NOTE: You are welcome to join the club anytime by following step by step instructions below, this event is just a reminder and this is NOT a Zoom meeting as not everybody is comfortable on video.
Find a buddy in London Friends Club in 3 steps:
STEP 1: Login to Xeeders, Join London Club and introduce yourself and mention what you are looking for: https://www.xeeders.com/london/
Example:
• Looking for a friend in London to chat online
• Looking for a friend in London to Hangout
• Looking for Travel Buddy in London for a Road Trip/Trekking/Weekend Getaway
• Looking for a Buddy to Play Badminton this Weekend in London
• Looking for a Buddy to Watch Movie in London
• Looking for a Walking/Jogging Buddy in London
• Looking for a Workout Buddy in London
• Looking for an Artist/Singer/Musician/Actor to make a short movie in London etc.,
STEP 2: Update your profile with your location and interests. NOTE: providing accurate information will help Xeeders AI algorithm in connecting you to right people.
That's it Xeeders AI algorithm will connect you to right people in London based on your interests and request. You can also respond to others looking for friends in the club.
STEP 3: Install Mobile app from below links to instantly chat with connected people.
o Andriod App - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=app.xeeders.android
o iOS App - https://apps.apple.com/us/app/xeeders/id1465871167
P.S. Our members and moderators are committed to build a friendly community. Anybody found disrespecting others or spreading negativity, hate speech or spamming will be blocked without warning.
Also, This app is not meant for dating and any misconduct will not be entertained.
How it works: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Am5MdxJkGYs
