293563699.Name: #15 Carbon & web3 Ecosystem in 2023
293563699.Long Description:
Registration through Eventbrite only.
(This event is part of PB's 5th anniversary and a series of events in Berlin with global impact blockchain ecosystem members from INATBA, the IOTA Foundation, EUBOF, BC 100+, Berlin Partners, BerChain, UNIC. More info on the events here.
Carbon or Environmental credits have existed since decades and started to see a growth in adoption and attention in the past year because of their potential to solve some of our burning climate change issues. However, the current market are frequently judged opaque, unorganised, and fragmented.
E﻿ntrepreneurs and creatives in the blockchain and web3 space have seen opportunities since 2016 to address some of these issues. With the increase in maturity and democratization of technologies such as Smart Contracts, Tokenization, NFTs, Oracles, DAOs, and more, a real ecosystem has emerged in the carbon x web3 space.
W﻿e can now count hundreds of projects active in the carbon value chain, whether it is in the origination of funding of environmental projects, data verification (dMRV), tokenization and trading, or offsetting.
W﻿here are we in 2013? How does the ecosystem look like and what are the current trends and challenges? Is the web3 approach solving or adding more fragmentation? Is the idea of a unique environmental token a good or bad one?
J﻿oin us in this exciting meetup to dive more into the web3 x carbon space.
Whether you already know about this market, are a carbon or ReFi expert or are new to it, come to the exclusive opportunity and get to know the community!
AGENDA:
18:15 - Arrival & settle in
18:30 - Welcome & Introduction
18:30 - 19:30 - Lightening Presentations
M﻿aximilian Roesger - ECOTA
L﻿ucas Zaehringer - PositiveBlockchain & Verity Tracking
A﻿lison Filer - Climate Collective
T﻿BA
T﻿BA
19:30 - 19:45 - Break
19:45 - Fish Bowl discussion
20:15 - Networking & drinks
21:00 - Event concludes
T﻿he meetup is organized by Positiveblockchain in partnership with ECOTA, Climate Collective and Celo.
L﻿ooking forward to seeing you there!
CO-ORGANIZERS
**PositiveBlockchain **is the open database, knowledge platform and community exploring the potential of blockchain technologies for social and environmental impact. The database currently lists more about 1400+ projects and startups using blockchain technologies for good. Projects are either crowd-sourced or identified and qualified by PositiveBlockchain or its alliance partners comprising associations, universities or blockchain foundations. PositiveBlockchain is a contributor-based non-profit association registered in Paris and active globally.
Celo is the carbon-negative, mobile-first, EVM-compatible blockchain ecosystem leading a thriving new digital economy for all.
ECOTA - the European Carbon Offset Tokenization Association - is a think tank that aims to find token-based solutions for a route to a net-zero Europe.
Do you want to speak at this event? Contact us at hello@positiveblockchain.io
This event will take place at the Celo office at Factory Görli.

293737078.Name: Web3 and Metaverse: Exploring Examples and Use Cases
293737078.Long Description:
Looking to explore the cutting-edge technologies that are revolutionizing the way we interact with the digital world? Look no further 👀
Our expert will be sharing her insights and experiences on how the integration of Web3 and the Metaverse is changing the way we interact with the digital world.
This event is designed to provide a platform for individuals, entrepreneurs, and businesses to explore and understand how Web3 and Metaverse technologies can be utilized to create unique and engaging experiences, through real-life use cases.
Erin will be showcasing examples of how this innovative technology is already being used in the real world, including virtual fashion and gaming, to name a few. We will also be discussing the various use cases of Web3 and Metaverse technologies, including decentralized finance, non-fungible tokens, and virtual identities 🚀
This event is a must-attend for anyone interested in the future of technology and its impact on our lives. Whether you're an entrepreneur, investor, or simply curious about the possibilities of this exciting new technology, you won't want to miss this opportunity.
So join us on 19/06 and be a part of this exciting conversation! Register now to secure your spot.

293798176.Name: Web3 Technologies Enabling New Enterprise & Government Solutions
293798176.Long Description: Enterprise blockchain has evolved from being primarily about track & trace capabilities on shared ledger and cross-ecosystem transactions to incorporate tokenization of digital assets using fungible tokens and NFTs, decentralized identity, wallets, hybrid ledger approaches, and other Web3 capabilities. This session will delve into why Web3 is relevant to enterprises and highlight how some key Hyperledger technologies and member innovations are used to support these capabilities. We will share a broad range of use cases across B2B and B2C enterprises leveraging Web3 capabilities across permissioned and public chains.

General chat & market news
An open forum for Q & As on anything and everything Crypto, Web3 and blockchain
Any sessions community members want to present to the group
Whether you're a seasoned Crypto pro or have just taken an interest and want to find out more about the space, you're more than welcome to join us.
If you want to take a deeper dive into a particular project or topic or are just interested in how to buy your first crypto or NFT - we cover it all in an open friendly environment.
Everyone is at different levels and has a different background, so come along and have a conversation and share your thoughts :)

Invite your web3 friends, we look forward to seeing you this Friday!
👉 QuimFT by Happyfact
QuimFT, represents the first collection of digital assets by the artist Quim Barreiros with the aim of bringing all his confidence and essence to the blockchain, offering his fans something exclusive and innovative. The exclusive collection of 1000 NFTs is a tribute to his most popular hits, from "Cabritinha" to "Garagem da Vizinha", being considered a digital treasure. With QuimFT, collectors have the opportunity to have a piece of the history of Portuguese culture in their hands, in virtual format, representing the new era of Web3.

293710704.Name: Videojuegos y programación Blockchain. Café SÚPER PIONEROS.
293710704.Long Description:
¿Quieres presentarte a la Comunidad SÚPER PIONEROS?. Este miércoles 31 de Mayo de forma online participa en este Café Grupal Súper Pioneros donde podrás presentarte pedir y un deseo, y donde aprenderemos sobre videojuegos blockchain y programación blockchain junto a Toni Moral CEO SatoshisGoal o Miguel Ventura CEO de Nikode (y algún invitado sorpresa por confirmar).
Este Café Grupal SÚPER PIONEROS es una evolución de los almuerzos y Cafés online que realizamos donde las plazas se agotan a toda velocidad, donde han nacido tantísimas sinergias entre cracks tecnológicos y donde muchas personas se han quedado fuera. Este nuevo formato permite aprender de temáticas de forma online así como poder presentarnos para tener visibilidad.
Estamos muy contento de ir retomando los encuentros presenciales para conocer a toda la Comunidad SÚPER PIONEROS, la semana pasada fue una pasada volver a ver tantísimos miembros en Open Expo Madrid y vienen muchas más paradas (un adelanto Murcia, Málaga y más...). Nuestro reto es llegar a los 50K miembros a final de año y para ello no vamos a parar de hacer cosas. ¡GRACIAS!!
El Café Súper Pioneros grupal está dirigido por José Luis Cáceres, ingeniero industrial y emprendedor en internet desde 1997 con gran experiencia en validación, desarrollo y aceleración de ideas innovadoras.
Actividades del encuentro.
- En el encuentro aprenderás más sobre WEB3, Blockchain y cripto alrededor de los juegos.
- En el encuentro podrás presentarte al grupo y pedir un deseo.
- En el encuentro conseguirás recursos, visibilidad y apoyo para tu idea, aprender o participar.
José Luis es actualmente Chief Brand Officer Bit2Me y CEO de NWC10Lab, este pequeño gran laboratorio de ideas digitales especializado en tecnología WEB3, blockchain y cripto donde ya somos más de 30K SÚPER PIONEROS aprendiendo y ayudando a los emprendedores más disruptivos del momento.
Nos vemos este miércoles 31.
Mil gracias a todos.
https://www.nwc10lab.com

292601303.Name: 13. KRYPTO & AI MEETUP - Blockchain, Prompt Engineering, NFT, Metaverses, Web3
292601303.Tags: Investing,Virtual Currency,Decentralized Systems & Applications,Digital Currency,Smart Contracts
292601303.Long Description:
🌳 In der heutigen Welt spielt Technologie eine sehr wichtige Rolle.
Du kennst bestimmt ChatGPT, Bitcoin und andere technologische Neuerungen der heutigen Zeit.
Genau um diese Technologien geht es!
- Wie funktionieren sie?
- Wie werden sie genutzt?
- Welche Potentiale liefern sie für uns als Menschen, die offen in die Zukunft gehen?
Wir haben entschieden, dass wir das Krypto und AI Meetup aufbauen, um eine Plattform zu bieten, über die wir uns zu diesen Technologien austauschen können.
Wir vernetzen sowohl Unternehmen, als auch Freelancer und Privatpersonen, die sich in diesem Bereich für die Technologien interessieren. Du lernst vor allem gemeinsam mit uns, wie du diese Technologien nutzt.
Du verstehst zum Beispiel:
- wie du ChatGPT optimal nutzt.
- wie du die Bilder KI Midjourney nutzt
- aber auch unterhalten wir uns über neue Anwendungen im Bereich Krypto Currencies, Blockchain und tauschen hier unser Wissen zu Utilities aus.
🤝 Wir sind der Meinung, gemeinsam ist es einfacher in die Welt von Krypto & AI einzusteigen.
Durch den Austausch und die Erfahrungen lernen wir voneinander schneller als alleine.
Ich freue mich, dieses Meetup für dich zu organisieren, um den Transfer zwischen dir und der Community zu fördern.
Erleichterter Einstieg durch gemeinsame Motivation
Erfahrungen aus der Praxis von Menschen wie dir
Leicht verständliches Grundverständnis zur Blockchain-Technologie und AI
Tipps und Tricks für Tools, Plattformen und Kryptowährungen
📝 Ablauf:
17:00 Begrüßung und Einstieg
17:10 Utility KASPA
17:30 Anwendungsfälle für BlockDAG
17:50 Fragen & Antworten
18:00 Ende

293807574.Name: Master the Proven 3-Step System to Achieve Financial Success Money Management
293807574.Tags: Business,Financial Freedom,Entrepreneurship,Building an Online Business,Money Management
293807574.Long Description:
Unlock the Secret to Financial Success: Discover My 3-Step Formula for Effective Money Management Without Compromising Your Lifestyle
In these challenging times of inflation, rising interest rates, and economic uncertainty, there is still a path to prosperity.
Despite external factors, individuals can thrive in any economy with the right approach.
But how can you not only survive but thrive, regardless of external events?
The key lies within your own internal economy and mindset, which have a greater impact on your financial success than external circumstances.
Recent events have revealed a stark reality: many people lack a backup plan or savings to weather short-term crises like job loss or unexpected bills.
That's why learning to master your money is crucial – it's the first step toward building wealth and attaining financial freedom.
Join our exclusive live online training, where I will personally guide you through a 28-day journey to regain control of your finances without sacrificing the quality of your life.
Meet Charles Kelly:
With expertise as a sought-after speaker, podcaster, author, property investor, digital marketing, and business consultant, Charles Kelly has made appearances as an expert guest on renowned TV and radio shows such as BBC News and Radio 5.
His mission is to empower individuals by providing training and education, teaching effective money management strategies, and equipping them with the skills to generate income.
Don't miss this opportunity to learn the proven techniques that have helped countless individuals achieve financial freedom.
Register now and take the first step toward transforming your financial future

293273280.Name: Gerrit Beine: "Die Ökonomie von Gut und Crypto. Eine Kritik."
293273280.Tags: Programming Languages,Software Architecture,Computer Programming,Computer Science,Software Development
293273280.Long Description:
Liebe Interessierte,
wir haben wieder ein interessantes Thema für euch im Angebot. Gerrit Beine wird uns in das Thema "Die Ökonomie von Gut und Crypto. Eine Kritik." einführen.
Worum geht's?
In diesem Vortrag sollen die Folgen von Crypto-Währungen betrachtet werden.
Gerrit Beine zeigt euch im Vortrag die sozialen, ökonomischen und ökologischen Probleme, die das Experiment
Crypto-Währungen nach sich zieht. Dabei geht es um Umwelt im Sinne von Natur, aber auch im Sinne von
lebenswertem Raum. Es geht um Existenzen von Menschen und von Staaten. Er zeigt, warum die Crypto-Währungen
keines ihrer Versprechen zu Dezentralisierung und Freiheit einhalten können. Mehr noch, es zeigt sich deutlich, dass
die Parallelgesellschaften, die durch solche Systeme entstehen, alle Entwickler:innen zwingen, sich moralischen Fragen zu stellen.
Ziel ist es, dass nach dem Vortrag ein Bewusstsein für die Probleme, die mit dem Einsatz von Crypto-Währungen einhergehen, besteht.
Gerrit Beine - Kurzprofil:
Gerrit Beine ist seit 1998 in der IT unterwegs, seit 2001 mit agilen Methoden. Er baut gerne Brücken zwischen Softwarearchitektur und Organisationen.
Dauer:
Der Vortrag selbst wird ca. 60 Minuten dauern, im Anschluss folgt gerne noch ein Q&A.
Vortragssprache:
Deutsch
Direkteinstieg:
https://dtag.webex.com/dtag/j.php?MTID=m68c184d48f453121a39fba27c207248f
Meeting-ID: 2734 054 7604
Meeting-Passwort: JVimBpqi376

292601281.Name: 12. Krypto & AI Meetup - ChatGPT Special
292601281.Tags: Investing,Virtual Currency,Decentralized Systems & Applications,Digital Currency,Smart Contracts
292601281.Long Description:
CHAT GPT SPECIAL
Das Tool ChatGPT wird zunehmend genutzt, um Texte, als auch andere Anwendungen schneller zu erstellen und zu vereinfachen. Wir nutzen es aktiv heute schon, um Workshops vorzubereiten, für Social Media Content zu produzieren und auch zum Teil für inhaltliche Recherchen und Kundenprojekte.
Wie das funktioniert und was die besten Prompts und Befehle sind, wollen wir dir in einem Meetup vorstellen. Das Meeup läuft so ab, dass wir dir einige Dinge zu den Inhalten vorstellen werden und uns auch in der Community austauschen, um voneinander zu lernen.
Was sind beispielsweise die besten Befehle/Prompts, die du kennst?
Die Inhalte und der Austausch des Meetups werden dokumentiert und du erhältst diese im Nachgang per Mail zugeschickt, so dass du eine Zusammenfassung des Termins hast.
Gemeinsam ist es einfacher neue Dinge zu lernen. Aus dieser Motivation heraus, haben wir das Meetup gegründet und es ist ein einmaliges "ChatGPT SPECIAL" in der Reihe der Krypto und AI Meetups. Durch Austausch, Wissenstransfer und Erfahrungen lernen wir voneinander schneller als alleine.
Ich freue mich auf deine Teilnahme.
Wir sehen uns.
Liebe Grüße Marc

17:10 ChatGPT Anwendung
17:30 Hilfreiche Prompts und Befehle

293675698.Name: 3rd DeFi For Good International Conference (via Zoom)
293675698.Long Description:
The third Decentralized Finance (DeFi) For Good international conference will start after lunch at 1:15 pm CEST Geneva time on Wednesday June 7th 2023 via Zoom in English.

292426126.Name: KI Park TechTalk: AI discovers cause for scrap in complex variant production
292426126.Tags: New Technology,Natural Language Processing,Data Science,Artificial Intelligence,Big Data
292426126.Long Description:
This presentation focuses on the root cause discovery for minor quality in high-variant automotive supply production. With the help of self-learning and explaining AI, complex root-cause findings can be reduced from several days to hours.
High variant complexity is caused by the production of around 11,000 transmissions per day in 700 variants. Every transmission consists of up to 600 parts. There are various suppliers and almost 1,000 machineries in the plant.
Why are semantic networks and thus explanatory AI needed?
The domain experts want to understand why an AI decides how. They do not want to understand the algorithms behind it, but want the reasons to be presented transparently from their domain point of view. On the one hand, this ensures acceptance, but on the other hand, complex disturbing factors are uncovered. From this, domain experts can derive modified procedures or processes.
Why are self-learning algorithms and thus adaptive AI needed?
In such a multi-variant production, the processes are very complex and constantly changing.
Only an AI that permanently brings added value - and not just for a limited period of time - can assert itself here. Therefore, the AI must adapt to the changes. It is only worthwhile for companies to introduce and roll out AI if this AI makes the adjustments itself, i.e. without the intervention of data scientists.
The Speaker of the Tech Talks is Britta Hilt.
Britta Hilt has focused on Artificial Intelligence since 2011, mainly from a usage perspective. She is co-founder and managing director of the AI company IS Predict which has focused on automating Data Science as well as on explaining AI.
For more details please visit https://bit.ly/TechTalk13062023

293758393.Name: AI and Print-on-Demand: Discover the Future of E-commerce
293758393.Tags: Etsy Sellers,Entrepreneurship,Building an Online Business,Passive Income,E-Commerce
293758393.Long Description:
Embrace the Power of AI: Transforming Print-on-Demand Business
Are you ready to witness a revolutionary shift in the world of print-on-demand? Imagine starting your online business without worrying about stock or storage space. Picture yourself creating captivating designs and witty quotes effortlessly, all thanks to the incredible potential of artificial intelligence (AI). This is your chance to witness firsthand how AI is reshaping the print-on-demand landscape!
Join us for an exceptional presentation featuring Nigel Wymer, a renowned business mentor, coach, and print-on-demand specialist. With over 16 years of experience and a six-figure income from selling on Etsy, Nigel has embraced AI to revolutionize his POD ventures.
During this enlightening session, Nigel will unveil the game-changing role of AI in establishing a thriving print-on-demand enterprise. Discover why Etsy stands as the ultimate platform for showcasing your unique creations. Gain invaluable insights into building a powerful brand and learn expert strategies for shop setup, design, search engine optimization (SEO), and pay-per-click (PPC) advertising. The real game-changer, though, lies in leveraging the untapped potential of AI.
Imagine having AI at your fingertips, enabling you to create stunning visuals, generate compelling item titles and descriptions, and even conduct in-depth keyword research to boost your products' visibility and rankings. The best part? These AI-powered tools are entirely free of charge, revolutionizing the way you do business!
Incredible research by StraitsResearch, a prestigious fortune 500 company, forecasts a monumental shift in the print-on-demand market. From a value of $4.91 billion in 2021, it is projected to soar to a staggering $39.87 billion by 2030. Moreover, the demand for personalized products is anticipated to surge at an astonishing annual growth rate of approximately 36%.
Don't miss out on this remarkable opportunity to witness the convergence of AI and print-on-demand! Nigel, with his multiple successful Etsy shops, will share his firsthand experience of leveraging AI in his print-on-demand endeavors. Discover why this cutting-edge technology is transforming the online business landscape, and be inspired by Nigel's incredible journey of starting a niche print-on-demand shop focused solely on mugs, which rapidly soared to over 620 sales within just 18 weeks and was ranked in the top 8% of Etsy shops for sales performance in the same time. A year later, that shop ranks in the top 2% of high-performing Etsy stores.
Seize this extraordinary opportunity to learn from Nigel's expertise and unlock the full potential of AI in the print-on-demand industry. Spaces are limited, so secure your spot now and embark on a transformative journey into the future of print-on-demand!

293779806.Name: Start Your Print-on-Demand Business with AI Technology
293779806.Tags: Etsy Sellers,Starting an Online Business,Entrepreneurship,Passive Income,Extra Income
293779806.Long Description:
Would you like to work from home? Whether you want to replace your 9-5 or make a side income to pay for a new car, holidays or meals out?
Are you looking for a genuine business opportunity not a 'pie-in-the-sky' course that promises huge results that never materialize?
Maybe you have heard of print-on-demand?
It may sound complicated.
I get it, you don't know where to start but you are missing one of the best online business opportunities today.
All you need is a laptop and an internet connection, you can work from anywhere and it costs almost nothing to set up.
Many confuse it with printing e-books or self-publishing. It is nothing like that. It is a process where you create very simple designs on your laptop, which you put onto a range of products from mugs to t-shirts, phone cases to keyrings. Better still, you link your shop to a specialist manufacturer who makes your items, packs them and ships them. You don't even have to see your products.
You don't need to be an artist or have any artistic ability - our guest speaker for this event, Nigel Wymer hasn't! If you can type your name, you can create a bestselling print-on-demand product.
Nigel has been making a living exclusively online for over 16 years. He will explain why Etsy is the best marketplace to start your new business empire.
Far from being a small marketplace, Etsy has been experiencing MASSIVE growth in the last 2 years, far greater than eBay. It is now the third largest online marketplace in the UK with over 94.15 million active buyers but only 7 million sellers. And it is free to open a shop....
On this session Nigel will show you...
- The massive opportunity that is Print-on-Demand
- Why You Should be Selling on Etsy
- How to Use Etsy to Build Your Own Brand
- What Products to Sell
- How to Find Ideas and Niches to Target
- How to use software to analyse your competitors' listings and find all their keywords!
- Professional Shop Set-Up and Design
- How to Use Simple SEO to Get Your Items Ranked on the First Page - no html Required
- Optimising Shop Listings for Mobiles
- How to create photos and videos of products that don't yet exist
- Coupon Promotion
- How to Build a Loyal Following of Repeat Buyers
Plus - lots of other inside tips!
Nigel's events are always in great demand so register NOW to be sure of a place.

293768884.Name: How to utilize AI in a print on demand business on Etsy
293768884.Tags: Cashflow,Business Strategy,Professional Networking,Building an Online Business,Network Marketing
293768884.Long Description:
Maybe you have heard about print-on-demand? Or maybe you have looked into this fantastic opportunity but don't know where to start?
Join Nigel Wymer on this informative presentation to learn the essential steps to setting up a successful print-on-demand business.
Print-on-demand or POD, as it is often referred to, is a massive opportunity for anyone wanting to work from home, either for a lucrative side income or to replace your 9-5.
Print-on-demand is the massively growing market that anyone can do, you don't need to be artistic or be able to draw, you just need to take action and follow the process Nigel explains.
In addition, the innovation that is AI - artificial intelligence, has made things even easier, allowing you to use AI, completely free of charge to create unique images and funny quotes for your designs. You can even get it to write your item titles and descriptions and research keywords to get your items ranked.
As a challenge Nigel opened a brand new print-on-demand shop on Etsy selling just mugs. Within 18 weeks he had made over 600 sales and his shop was ranked in the top 8% of performing shops. In this session he will spill the beans on how you can do it too.
Print-on-demand is predicted to grow by 33% over the next 3 years with demand for personalized products predicted to grow at an even higher rate. And you can set it up for almost zero cost - you never see your items, do not have to buy stock until it is sold and you don't even have to pack or post anything - your chosen manufacturer will do it all for you.
It sounds too good to be true doesn't it? But, it is probably the best online business model out there today - a genuine opportunity to start your own online business with no need for a website or social media or to drive traffic.
Nigel has many years of experience with several highly successful shops and has earned six figure sums from selling on Etsy, his chosen marketplace for starting a POD business. He will explain why you should start your business on Etsy and not eBay or Amazon.
WHO IS NIGEL WYMER?
He has been making a living on the internet for over 15 years. He started online with an eBay shop in the early days which has expanded into several businesses.
He added Etsy to his portfolio of businesses several years ago and using his background in marketing, soon discovered the benefits of using Etsy to build successful businesses and more importantly how to grow and create a brand.
He specializes in print-on-demand because he believes it offers quicker results for a higher profit and less work than most traditional businesses.
He runs training courses on print-on-demand and Etsy.
On the event he will tell you the secret to making money on Etsy.
He will discuss:
Why You Should start Selling print-on-demand on Etsy and not eBay, Shopify or Amazon
The benefits of print on demand (and there are lots!)
How to Use Etsy to Build Your Own Brand
Professional Shop Set-Up and Design
Simple SEO - no html Required!
Print on demand - from start to finish
PPC Advertising
Working Out Profit Margins
Plus - lots of other inside tips!
Places will be limited so register quickly!
Don't miss this unique opportunity to learn from Nigel's talent and experience.
Register NOW

In addition, the innovation that is AI - artificial intelligence, has made things even easier, allowing you to use AI, completely free of charge to create unique images and funny quotes for your designs. You can even get it to write your item titles and descriptions and research keywords to get your items ranked.
As a challenge Nigel opened a brand new print-on-demand shop on Etsy selling just mugs. Within 18 weeks he had made over 600 sales and his shop was ranked in the top 8% of performing shops. In this session he will spill the beans on how you can do it too.
Print-on-demand is predicted to grow by 33% over the next 3 years with demand for personalized products predicted to grow at an even higher rate. And you can set it up for almost zero cost - you never see your items, do not have to buy stock until it is sold and you don't even have to pack or post anything - your chosen manufacturer will do it all for you.
It sounds too good to be true doesn't it? But, it is probably the best online business model out there today - a genuine opportunity to start your own online business with no need for a website or social media or to drive traffic.
Nigel has many years of experience with several highly successful shops and has earned six figure sums from selling on Etsy, his chosen marketplace for starting a POD business. He will explain why you should start your business on Etsy and not eBay or Amazon.
Nigel has been making a living on the internet for over 15 years. He started online with an eBay shop in the early days which has expanded into several businesses.
He added Etsy to his portfolio of businesses several years ago and using his background in marketing, soon discovered the benefits of using Etsy to build successful businesses and more importantly how to grow and create a brand.
He specializes in print-on-demand because he believes it offers quicker results for a higher profit and less work than most traditional businesses.
He runs training courses on print-on-demand and Etsy.

293470377.Long Description:
Adopt AI in Your Business Now! Live Expert Q&A: Survive, Thrive, or Fall Behind?" - Can you really say you are prepared for the AI revolution? Is your business ready to harness the power of AI and stay competitive in the market? Or will you be left behind, watching your rivals surge ahead?
A recent report by Business Solution predicts that the adoption of AI will displace up to 375 million jobs in the next decade.
Another study found that workers who earn up to £90,000 a year in Tech and Finance were the most likely to be exposed. Goldman Sachs estimates that around 18% of work globally could be automated—with more advanced economies heavily impacted than emerging markets.
Don't stand by and watch as your business falls prey to AI disruption. Secure your spot at our exclusive webinar and live Q&A on 1st June at 3PM BST and stay ahead of the curve.
What to expect from this expert Q&A
Our message is that you really CAN use the latest AI tools in your business and see 10x growth in productivity today!
The technology behind AI is complicated, but nothing about using it is - these tools are designed to help us be more productive in our every day work.
Join our cutting-edge webinar featuring three AI experts from the AI Leadership Lab who will discuss how to leverage AI for your business growth and success.
Seize this opportunity to learn from their vast experience and gain insights that will help you thrive in the AI-driven world.
Webinar Highlights:
Short presentation on AI and its impact on businesses
Live Q&A with AI experts Gary Lewis Cheetham, Tom Heubner, and Ross Heubner
Event Agenda:
Understanding AI and its implications for your business
Expert insights on AI implementation, challenges, and benefits
Live Q&A session with our panel of AI professionals
Act now! AI disruption is happening, and it won't wait for you to catch up. Don't let fear and uncertainty hold you back. Embrace the change, and transform your business with AI.
Remember, the future is now! Invest in the knowledge and tools necessary to stay competitive and grow your business. Your rivals won't wait, so why should you?
Reserve your spot today and embark on a journey towards AI-driven success. See you on 1st June at 3PM BST!
Meet your experts
Meet our esteemed AI Leadership Lab experts who will share their invaluable experience and insights at the upcoming webinar:
Gary Lewis Cheetham
Founder of GL Digital Automotive Marketing, a digital marketing visionary specialising in automotive and power sports dealerships. By harnessing AI, Gary has revolutionised marketing performance for his clients in the UK and the US.
At the webinar, Gary will share insights on leveraging AI in digital marketing efforts to foster growth and innovation.
He is the perfect expert to address questions on AI-driven marketing strategies and their impact on businesses.
Ross Heubner
A dynamic senior consultant with extensive experience in the multinational chemical manufacturing industry, Ross currently serves as an agile project manager and product owner.
He skillfully integrates generative AI tools into the software development life cycle, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team culture. At the webinar, Ross will share insights on leveraging AI to optimize software development processes and build strong team dynamics.
Ross is the go-to expert for questions on AI in project management, team collaboration, and software development.
Tom Heubner
A highly experienced technology leader, Tom has worked with industry giants like IBM and Microsoft and has led smaller enterprises in the tech space.
With a passion for change, Tom excels at identifying new business opportunities and overcoming IT challenges. As the Head of Sales for EMEA at Zerowait Corporation, Tom has been leveraging AI tools to help businesses succeed.
Tom is the ideal expert to answer questions on AI implementation, business growth, and overcoming IT challenges with AI-driven solutions.
---
By attending our webinar, you will gain insights from these experts on how AI can transform your business, helping you stay ahead of the competition.
Don't miss this opportunity to ask them questions tailored to their expertise and learn how to harness the power of AI for your business's success.

292382388.Name: Prebuild AI in Azure - Cognitive services
292382388.Tags: Database Professionals,Open Source,New Technology,Data Science,Machine Learning
292382388.Long Description:
Learn how to use prebuilt AI in Azure, from Cognitive services speech studio, as well as their solutions for content moderation, computer vision, or decision like anomaly detection.
In this session, we will see how to use the services with Python in a notebook in Machine learning service, but I will also show & explain the many other options for using cognitive services.
We will dive into the possibilities of the tools and how to easily get started.
We will go through 4 different tutorials:
- Speech & speech studio
- Text with translation, entity & sentiment analysis
- Decision with anomaly detection & content moderation
- Computer & custom vision
After this session, you should be ready to start using cognitive services in your everyday work.

293493776.Name: Street Smart AI Berlin meetup #2
293493776.Tags: Data Visualization,Artificial Intelligence,AI Algorithms,Machine Learning,Data Analytics
293493776.Long Description:
Welcome to the Street Smart AI meetup, where AI practitioners share the knowledge of making ML&DS happen for real live applications.
This time we are meeting offline in a venue hosted by Deutsche Telekom.
When: Tuesday, May 30, 18-30
Where: Französische Straße 33 a-c, 10117 Berlin, Deutsche Telekom AG
Hauptstadtrepräsentanz
ATTENTION! To attend the meetup, please:
Reserve a spot on Evenbright with the link: https://street-smart-ai.eventbrite.de. Please make sure your first and last name matches your ID.
2. Do not forget to bring your ID on the event day; venue security requires it.
Agenda:
18:30 – 19:00: Welcome and Networking
19:00 – 19:30: Lessons for industry from Kaggle competitions - Nikita Kozodoi, PhD, Kaggle Competitions Master, Applied Scientist at AWS
19:30 – 20:00: Pizza break and Networking
20:00 - 20:30: Industrial knowledge graphs - Anton Zubarev, ML Engineer, Deutsche Telekom
20:30–21:00: Networking
Event moderation - Evgeny Labzin, Ilya Boytsov
💥 Lessons for industry from Kaggle competitions
🔈 Nikita Kozodoi, Applied Scientist at AWS
Kaggle is an online platform that hosts large-scale ML competitions. In this talk, Nikita will discuss lessons and best practices used by data scientists who compete on Kaggle. Nikita will cover lessons that are useful in industry and can be leveraged in various ML projects.
💥 Industrial knowledge graphs
🔈 Anton Zubarev, ML Engineer at Deutsche Telekom
Knowledge graphs is a powerful yet complex approach for extracting insights from the data. Although their functions overlap with the modern LLMs, they have the advantage of being deterministic and interpretable. Combining the benefits of these two approaches can be very beneficial for business applications. In this talk, Anton will dive into knowledge graphs' role in structuring complex data, real-world applications, and the challenges in implementation.
Looking forward to seeing you!

293343897.Long Description:

2. The present architecture of transformers such as Google AI and GPT-4. 3. Supply Chain usage of transformer technology and generative AI.

293587073.Name: ✨ Empowering Diversity - Women in Tech Nights ✨
293587073.Long Description:
✨ Details ✨
N26 and AWS are very excited to invite you to the panel discussion around diversity, inclusion and women's allyship in the Tech industry. Join us in Berlin for an open conversation around women in the tech environment with experienced and passionate panellists.
All genders are welcome to attend! Come and join us in promoting and supporting gender diversity in the tech industry! ⚡
We’ll be covering:
Importance of women representation in tech leadership landscape
How can we make the changes happen
How to be an ally
Career progression and advice for the future generations
✨ Speakers ✨
Moderator: Sara Caselles Gaya - PM @N26
Sara has been working for N26 for the last year and a half and has a passion for inclusivity in the workplace. She has been co-leading the Women+ ERG and driving many initiatives in the organisation.
Miyu Lee - Chief Legal officer @Mondu
Miyu is a Harvard-trained international FinTech lawyer and economist with a PhD in econometrics. Before joining Mondu where she oversees the global legal and compliance topics, she worked at Klarna for 5 years assuming various roles managing global teams.
Olena Dr. Bachynska - VP Engineering @SmartRectiuiters
Olena is a very passionate technology leader, data scientist, engineer, physicist and a mother.
She has been working at SmartRecruiters for a year and a half and has a very strong background in other international companies.
Laura Figón - Development-Related Postgraduate Courses (EPOS) DAAD Scholar @Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin
Currently pursuing a master's degree, Laura is a Gender Equity and Social Inclusion Leader with over 10 years of experience in International and Development Economics. Laura is passionate about feminist economics as a way to reduce social inequality and foster economic progress. A former World Bank consultant, she has a keen interest in social innovation, public policy, and impact evaluation. Beyond her professional pursuits, Laura enjoys travelling, arts, and culture.
Julian Kelsey - Engineering Manager @N26
Julian has over 30 years working as a software developer in 4 different countries. He is also a member of the Works Council as he believes it’s very important to make the workplace a better place and have an impact.
Beyza Ari - DEI Lead @AWS
Beyza specialises in Inclusion, Diversity and Equity at AWS.
Her main focus is on expanding the dimensions of diversity to ensure everyone feels heard and secure in their environment. She organises events, creates frameworks and structures while drafting strategies, has hosted workshops on bias-free decision making for internal and external stakeholders.
✨ Agenda ✨
18:00 - 18:30: Doors open, grab a drink!
18:30 - 18:45: Opening session by Artem Shchodro, Principal Solutions Architect & Sara Caselles Gaya, Associate Product Manager
18:45 - 20:00: Panel discussion - "Empowering Diversity"
20:00 - 20:30: Q&A with all the panelists
20:30 - 21:00: Snacks & drinks
This event is part of the Women in Tech Nights, an initiative aimed at fostering gender diversity and inclusion within the technology sector. Our events take place in various locations and are held in collaboration with AWS, Glovo, and other partners. Keep an eye out for upcoming exciting events.
✨ Registration ✨
The event will not be streamed or recorded.
In order to register, please follow the link below.
https://www.aws-experience.com/emea/dach-cee/e/8e2a0/berlin-women-in-tech-meetup
Registrations on the meetup.com will not be sufficient.
Please be ready to show a photo ID at your arrival.

293737071.Name: New Beginnings: Find a job with flexible working conditions in tech!
293737071.Long Description:
Stuck in your job or unemployed? Want to work remotely, as a freelancer or a digital nomad? Get in charge of your career and start in tech!
# ❓About the Event
At this event, you will learn how to start a flexible and secure career. The Digital Career Institute is a certified education provider that helps people with no prior technical experience to get a start in tech.
Want to get into the tech industry too? Secure, well-paid, and flexible jobs are waiting for you! 🚀
# 💫 Contents
Learn about the post-Covid working conditions
Best jobs with flexible working conditions
Easy career change opportunities
Discover 100% financed courses to start in tech if you are unemployed
Our students come from very different backgrounds. 🌈 They have many different professional backgrounds, are young and old, and come from over 110 different nations. They are proof that anyone can make it in the tech industry.
Work from home, as a digital nomad or freelancer. Be valued by employers the way you deserve it.💙
We are looking forward to meeting you!
Your DCI-Team

293770617.Name: How Non-Techies Can Launch Successful Tech Startups
293770617.Long Description:
This event is organized by TechSpeak.
Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.
This event is FREE to attend!
In order to attend, please register here:
http://bit.ly/3rpVxZl
(Registrants will receive login info right before the start of the event.)
As a non-techie, If you want to launch a successful tech startup your goal shouldn’t be to learn how to code and create your own app. Your goal should be to learn how to build the right team and implement the right processes to execute your idea. Then you need to go to market as fast as possible so you don’t miss out on the market opportunity.
Join us for a FREE 60 minute online masterclass and learn what non-technical founders need to know to launch a successful tech startup.
You will learn:
The one most important skill that you must have in the early stages of your startup to be successful
Why it’s so hard to find a technical co-founder or CTO and what you should do instead to get your idea off the ground
Two money-saving skills you need in order to test ideas without engaging a developer
How to define your MVP properly to reduce the cost and time required to develop your app
The importance of process
and more!
Please come with your questions and scenarios.
About the Speaker
Nelly Yusupova is a CTO, with over 18 years of experience leading organizations to technical excellence. She is a startup tech advisor, outsourced CTO, and the creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs.
Nelly is on a mission to help entrepreneurs minimize technology mistakes. Through her online master class TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, she provides the roadmap to successfully manage technology teams and projects.
Just recently included in Fast Company’s, “League of Extraordinary Women”, Nelly has been at the forefront of the women’ s movement online since 1999 and is one of the Wall Street Journal’s “Women on the IT Fast Track”.
Nelly is a speaker and presenter for many organizations and presented at many major industry events, including: Women’s Enterprise Center, New York Entrepreneurs Business Network, Small Business Summit, BlogHer, Social Media Jungle, Mom 2.0, BlogWorld, and more.
She has been featured in Inc. Magazine, NBC's Today Show, Fast Company, NewsDay.com, O’Reilly, Smart Money, Small Biz, TechRepublic, Women’s Radio and more.
Nelly can be reached at:
nelly@techspeak.co

293733482.Name: Stimulating Nordic & Baltic Ecosystems: Jeanette Carlsson, Tech Nordic Advocates
293733482.Long Description:
The Nordic & Baltic tech scene is more exciting than ever with success stories from Spotify, Klarna and Spotify to Trustly, Just Eat, Revolut, Trust Pilot, Transferwise, Funderbeam - the list keeps growing.
With small home markets in terms of population, Nordic & Baltic startups develop products and services with global markets in mind - first step is the region and then it's the world.
Welcome to our fireside chat with a leading Nordic & Baltic startup & tech ecosystem expert, Jeanette Carlsson, Founder & CEO of Tech Nordic Advocates.
In this fireside chat we discuss:
⭐️ What makes Nordics & Baltics a unique ecosystem?
⭐️ What opportunities are waiting to be tapped in this ecosystem?
⭐️ As a startup founder, what are critical ecosystem resources needed for success in the region?
⭐️ What collaboration opportunities exist in the region?
⭐️ Once you have built your startup / reputation in the region, how do you go global?
⭐️ How is TNA positioning itself in the regional ecosystem?
⭐️ How can startups and ecosystem builders benefit from TNA services?
⭐️ What is Jeanette's practical advice to entrepreneurs around building startup / ecosystem communities?
Jeanette is a recognized tech founder / CEO, blue-chip exec, digital Innovation and transformation leader, board, government, VC and diplomatic advisor, NED, mentor, innovation/entrepreneurship lecturer, conference chair/ keynote, and a startup investor/expert with a 30 year track record of building, growing & advising startups to PLCs in the fast-paced digital/tech/innovation space.
The discussion will be moderated by Naimul Abd - serial impact entrepreneur and Regional Director Nordics at Startup Grind.
Agenda
---
Speaker
Jeanette Carlsson - Tech Nordic Advocates (Founder & CEO)
Jeanette is a tech sector Founder/CEO, blue-chip exec, digital Innovation and transformation leader, board, government, VC and diplomatic advisor, NED, mentor, innovation/entrepreneurship lecturer, conference chair/ keynote, startup/investor expert with a 30 year track record of building, growing & advising startups to PLCs in the fast-paced digital/tech/innovation space. She is passionate…
Hosted By
Naimul Abd, Regional Director Nordics Startup Grind
Startup and ecosystems specialist, impact entrepreneur and venture-builder, and a career marketing director and consultant - Naimul Abd has worked across several business verticals, advised dozens of multinational companies, built high-growth businesses and consulting organizations, and is actively involved in startup and impact ecosystem in Stockholm. Currently a business advisor at Coompanion Stockholm (a Startup Grind Stockholm partner) - he coaches more than 500 startup founders annually, is responsible for partner relations, and organizes dozens of startup events every year. He is also building an early-stage startup portfolio through his venture-builder Globalities. Naimul believes in the power of imagination and sees startup founders as problem solvers for the world. He loves to make music in his free time and some of his work is available on Spotify and other online stores.
---
Global Partner
Microsoft Teams (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-teams/teams-for-home)
Communities in Microsoft Teams brings everyone together in one place. Engage in community discussions, share files and photos, join video calls, and plan events. No more switching between apps to connect and get things done.
Partner
Tech Nordic Advocates (https://www.technordicadvocates.org/)
Tech Nordic Advocates is Northern Europe's largest tech / startup ecosystem accelerating Nordic & Baltic tech startup & scaleup growth.
---
Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 600 cities and 125+ countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
---
Complete your event RSVP here: https://www.startupgrind.com/events/details/startup-grind-stockholm-presents-stimulating-nordic-baltic-ecosystems-jeanette-carlsson-tech-nordic-advocates/.

293423450.Name: Improve your communication skills to deliver your values
293423450.Long Description:
FREE SIGN UP
## Key Take-aways:
As a freelancer working with international clients, you tend to communicate in English most of the time. Even though you understand the language and speak it well, you may not always feel confident and worry that you're not expressing yourself as effectively as you could be in your mother tongue.
In this webinar, you'll identify your psychological blockers, unlock your values "superpowers," and learn how to get your message across effectively in your next pitch, presentation, negotiation or event.
We’ll discuss:
How to adapt your communication style to different cultural contexts and business situations
Enhance your public speaking skills and overcome your fear of presenting in front of others
Develop your active listening skills and learn how to ask better questions to understand your clients' needs and preferences
Understand how to use body language to build rapport and connect with your clients and colleagues
## Speakers:
Vanessa Henry Epstein is a highly skilled Business & Legal Communication Effective Coach with a passion for personal development. With more than 20 years of experience in business education, Vanessa is committed to helping individuals achieve their goals by shifting mindsets and accelerating success.
Vanessa specializes in public speaking and communication in English, particularly for individuals whose first language is not English. Her expertise in this area has helped many clients improve confidence, overcome language barriers, achieve goals and reach full potential.
1 June, 17:00- 17:45 (CEST)
SIGN UP FOR FREE

293710598.Name: Scaling Infrastructure for Growth
293710598.Long Description:
Flip.ro, one of the most promising circular economy startups in Romania, has an ambitious mission: to change the way people buy and sell refurbished phones.
As a leading player in the Romanian refurbished electronics market, Flip.ro has faced many challenges in scaling its infrastructure and teams to achieve growth. However, the company has managed to overcome tough terrain by implementing several key strategies and best practices.
Florin Bombeanu, Chief Technology Officer, joins Cornel Fatulescu, Pentalog’s Chief Platform Officer, to discuss the complex process of building a state-of-the-art e-commerce platform capable of handling large volumes of traffic and transactions, enabling it to serve a growing customer base.
Date: Thursday, June 8, 2023  | Zoom
Time: 5 PM CEST / 4 PM BST / 11 AM EDT
Attendance is free but requires pre-registration: https://bit.ly/3q4a0y2
If you can't join the webinar on June 8, don't worry! Register anyway, and you'll receive a recording of the video later in the day. That way, you get access to the valuable insights shared by the speaker.
See you soon!

293489519.Name: Solving the Top Challenges of Senior Technology Leaders
293489519.Tags: Business Strategy,CIO / CTO,Private Equity,SaaS (Software as a Service),Chief Technology Officer
293489519.Long Description:
Are you a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) or a technical manager looking for practical solutions for overcoming your most pressing pain points in 2023? Join us for a webinar featuring two seasoned CTOs who will share their insights and strategies for success.
With a wealth of experience in leading technology teams and driving innovation in their companies, host Cornel Fatulescu, Chief Platform Officer at Pentalog, with guest Christian Larsen, Technical Director at Marlin Equity Partners, will provide insights into the private equity perspective, and share their thoughts on how CTOs can navigate a rapidly changing landscape.
Christian Larsen works closely with SaaS companies in their investment portfolios, and has a unique perspective on the challenges and opportunities they face in the current market.
Date: Tuesday, May 30, 2023 | Zoom
Time: 5 PM CEST / 4 PM BST / 11 AM EDT
Attendance is free but requires pre-registration: https://bit.ly/3LYrBPh
The conversation will cover:
The latest trends and challenges in the tech industry
Valuable insights on how to stay ahead of the curve
In addition to the webinar, we are offering one-on-one sessions with our guests. These spots are limited, so be sure to register early to increase your chances of being selected.
All registrants will receive a link following the event, to replay at any time. This way, you’ll get access to the valuable insights we will be sharing.
See you soon!

Janna Bastow is the inventor of the Now-Next-Later roadmap and is co-founder and CEO of ProdPad, product management and roadmapping software for product people. Janna is also co-founder of ProductTank and Mind the Product, the global community of product managers. 17:00 - 17:05 Intros
17:05 - 18:00 Presentation and Q&A

We are on a mission to help companies discover and deliver great products faster. We do this by empowering our community to share knowledge generously. And through our consulting engagements, we do all the hands-on and unglamorous work of a Product Manager on an Interim basis (3-12 months). We onboard fast, align teams and deliver outcomes. 😉

293757639.Name: Berlin Climate Tech Drinks
293757639.Long Description:
Meet climate tech founders, doers, students, investors, regulators – and people who are just interested in having a drink with people working on this problem!
Berlin Climate Tech Drinks is a monthly drinks meetup bringing together people working in this space for two hours of chatting in a relaxed, informal and curious atmosphere.
The agenda: a cold drink of your choice (alcoholic or otherwise!), networking with other people working in this space, and all in a very green room in classic Berliner Kneipe style. As the hosts, we'll be actively working to introduce you all to each other – so you meet as many people as possible (and no one feels like a lemon without anyone to chat with).
🚨 Kurzer Hinweis: Berlin Climate Tech Drinks ist auch für Deutschsprachler*innen offen! Wir gehen davon aus, dass die meisten Leute sich auf Englisch wohler fühlen werden, aber wir freuen uns ebenfalls auch darauf, euere schöne umlautbeladene Töne zu hören ✨
Bar
Das Gift has the usual range of soft drinks (around €2-3), beer (€3 between 17:00-19:00, €3.80 otherwise), and long drinks (around €8-10). There's also three non-alcoholic beers options, as well as good ol' Leitungswasser.
Food/snacks
We won't offer any food or snacks, but there are some for sale at the bar and 🤞 the nice samosa man will come by at some point. There's also a few options very close by for falafel, baked goods, and so on.
Hosts
Vanessa and Josh will be hosting. Feel free to add us on LinkedIn directly, or you can also email berlinclimatetech@gmail.com with any questions ahead of or after the event!
Networking
Ahead of time we'll send out an email pre-event with who's RSVP'd - let us know if you'd rather not be included on this!
House rules
Berlin Climate Tech Drinks is an accepting and safe space with a zero tolerance policy to discrimination (or even just unpleasantness) of any kind. Everyone should feel comfortable, regardless of their age, skin colour, gender identity, sexual orientation, or anything else. The same goes for before and after the event, as well as during. We will proactively ask anyone who doesn't follow this rule in action or spirit to leave and not attend future events, and would like to encourage attendees to get in touch with us if they experience or spot anyone experiencing distress.

293125399.Name: Berlin Video Tech: Round 9
293125399.Long Description:
We are happy to announce that Berlin Video Tech Meetup is back at Fraunhofer FOKUS in Berlin-Charlottenburg.
Again we will co-locate the Berlin Video Tech Meetup with the 10th! FOKUS Media Web Symposium. During two days the FOKUS Media Web Symposium (June 13-14 2023) covers technical aspects (workshop, tutorials, and exhibition on the first day) as well as trends and business related aspects (conference on the second day). Fore more information check: https://www.fokus.fraunhofer.de/go/mws
Register at https://mws10.eventbrite.com/ in order to attend the MWS conference before we will wrap up the day with the Berlin Video Tech meetup.
For the meetup, we will have two presentations as usual, followed by a casual get-together with drinks and food!
We are happy to announce two presentations:
Christoph Guttandin will be talking about "Spotting the TimingObject in the wild"
Benjamin Bross will present "Hands on: VVC encoding for adaptive streaming and playback with open source tools"
Looking forward to see you very soon,
Stefan Pham & Kaiser

293631859.Name: Lessons from a Microsoft Sr. Product Manager & Startup UX Advisor: Career Skills
293631859.Tags: Career Network,Product Launch,Product Development,Professional Development,Product Design
293631859.Long Description:
Brought to you by Equipt, your professional development community, to network, learn, and collaborate with professionals and recruiters through live online workshops and events. Here is an example of one of our Events (Lessons from a Google Senior Product Designer)
Access workshops, discord community, recordings, and jobs from partner companies @ JOINEQUIPT.COM/REGISTER
Bring your product manager or design questions or challenges, and our facilitator will answer questions and advise on how to best approach progressing your career or job hunt.
Facilitated by David Marc Siegel, Senior Product Manager at Microsoft, where he is responsible for critical franchise programs relating to the Minecraft Launcher and its interconnections throughout Xbox/Mojang ecosystems. He is also a Product & UX Advisor for multiple early-stage startups. David has over 10 years of experience making products people love that solve important customer problems!
In his many years of experience, he's helped organize all kinds of product teams - large and small, longstanding & brand new. He also really enjoys working with early career PMs to help them build their product skills & help them get professionally unstuck.
Class Details/FAQ
Who should attend this? Aspiring or Experienced Product Managers and Designers
What is the event format? Guided Q&A and Open Discussion
What will I leave with? career skills and job-hunting advice
Are there job opportunities? To be announced

290821925.Name: Monday Morning Tech-Talk
290821925.Tags: Oracle,Oracle Application Business Solutions,SQL Server,Oracle Developers,NoSQL
290821925.Long Description: Lasst uns neue Arbeitswochen mit einem 15minütigen Tech-Talk zu Themen rund um ORACLE SQL, PL/SQL und eventuell auch SQL Developer beginnen.

293487344.Name: Product Manager or Product Owner - A dangerous confusion of two roles?
293487344.Long Description:
### You are interested in the key differences between product owners and product managers? Well, here it comes!
I am excited to announce a partnership with one of the most renounces companies regarding product management, Product People.
They will preset the Product Manager and Product Owner and how they are often used interchangeably in the tech industry.
However, they have distinct responsibilities and differences in their focus areas. In this presentation, Viktoria Korzhova - VP of Product at Product People - will dive into the differences between these roles. Especially how to differentiate them, and how to know if a company is a right fit for you based on their job description.
### In this presentation, you'll learn
1. The key differences in between the two roles
2. How to distinguish them
3. How to better read job descriptions and find the right fit with a company
Presented by Viktoria Korzhova
Dr. Viktoria Korzhova, VP of Product at Product People, a Ph.D. in Neuroscience, has 6+ years of Product & Project Management experience. She has worked with both B2B and B2C products in different industries, including mobility, e-commerce, digital health/ wellness, travel, ed-tech, real estate, etc. She has experience leading multiple cross-functional teams to drive high-impact initiatives and worked effectively with executive leaders, peers, and direct reports.

292451700.Name: Klika Tech - Virtual Open House
292451700.Tags: Technology,Recruiting & Hiring,Employee Wellness,Internet of Things (IOT),Software Development
292451700.Long Description:
We're excited to announce our new "Virtual Open House" series of events.
Twice a month, people from our team, working on real projects including:
Project Managers
Software Developers
QA Engineers
Recruiters
and others
get together with our candidates and those interested in learning more about our company to share more about:
Our culture and company history;
Our projects, processes, and interesting technical challenges;
Our career opportunities;
Our bonus and benefit programs;
and the latest news and developments;
Our "Virtual Open House" events are designed to give you a sneak peek into the amazing world of Klika Tech. Discover why our employees are proud to be part of such a dynamic and inclusive company. You'll learn about our rich company culture, innovative bonus programs, company-paid training, and much more. You'll also get the chance to meet real project managers, engineers, and developers and ask them any questions you may have.
We believe that an atmosphere of trust and transparency is important, especially when we’re contemplating the next step in our careers. In these informal sessions, candidates are given the opportunity to get to know our team and our culture, even before applying for a vacancy.
These events will be held in English, online through Google Meet and will last approximately 30-45 minutes.
Join us and let’s discover what’s next together!

293787179.Name: Fuzzy Matching | YugabyteDB Friday Tech Talk
293787179.Long Description:
Our next YugabyteDB Friday Tech Talk (YFTT) takes place on LinkedIn Live, Friday 2nd June at 9:30am PT.
Join Yugabyte Principal Solutions Architect Valerie Parham-Thompson and Co-Founder Karthik Ranganathan as they discuss various methods and relative advantages of doing string lookups, including phonetic or "fuzzy" methods, in YugabyteDB.
We hope you are finding these tech talks useful. If there is a specific topic related to distributed SQL and YugabyteDB that you would like us to cover, please let us know.
You can attend and register for the event here: https://www.linkedin.com/events/7067910561040138240/about/

293542038.Name: QAfeteria - Tech Talks #5
293542038.Tags: Make New Friends,Webinars,Quality Assurance,QA Tools and Practices,Software QA and Testing
293542038.Long Description:
📌 Join us for an exciting and educational journey into the world of testing with our "QAfeteria" webinar series. Our team of top professionals will be sharing their extensive knowledge and experience on various aspects of testing, including test automation, metrics, growth opportunities, and more.
📣 Can't make it to the live session? No worries, we'll provide a recording of each session so that you won't miss out on any valuable insights.
The next QAfeteria: TechTalk takes place on 31 May, 6PM.
Breaking down the software testing approaches of the world's top IT companies: Join our webinar to learn more.
This webinar will be dedicated to the software testing methods used by top IT companies worldwide, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, and other industry leaders. Here's what you can expect:
✔️ A comprehensive review of their respective software testing practices, encompassing tools, techniques, similarities, differences, strengths, and limitations.
✔️ By analyzing these testing methods, you'll gain valuable insights into the most effective strategies and best practices for software testing in the technology sector.
🎤 Speaker: Denys Belozerskiy, Quality Architect II
🎤 Moderator: Boris Grgincic, Lead Software Test Automation Engineer
🕔 31.05 | 18:00-19:15 | Online
❗ Don't miss out on this opportunity to develop your knowledge, chat with our speaker and raise your questions!
Register now for free to secure your spot for the webinar 👇
https://epa.ms/1jbC5J

293621225.Name: FREE WEBINAR: How to Outsource Development of Your App
293621225.Long Description:
This event is organized by TechSpeak.
Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.
This event is FREE to attend!
In order to attend, please register here:
https://www.techspeakforentrepreneurs.com/outsource/?utm=ideatoipo
(Registrants will receive login info right before the start of the event.)
If you are a non-technical person with an idea for an app, you’re probably looking for a technical co-founder to help you build the app.
However, you can launch a tech startup by outsourcing code!
In the early days of your startup it can be challenging to attract a technical co-founder to build your app. But by knowing how to efficiently outsource the building of your MVP and gain some traction, you can de-risk the opportunity for the tech person and change the conversation from "I Need You" to "Here's an Opportunity".
In this webinar, the speaker will discuss the best way to outsource the development of your app, including:
Why outsourcing may be the best way to find a technical co-founder
Outsourcing best practices
How not get ripped off in the process
and more!
About the Speaker
Nelly Yusupova is a CTO, with over 18 years experience, leading companies to technical excellence. She is a startup tech advisor, outsourced CTO, and the creator of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs.
Nelly is on a mission to help entrepreneurs minimize technology mistakes. Through her online master class TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, she provides the roadmap to successfully manage technology teams and projects.
Just recently included in Fast Company’s, “League of Extraordinary Women”, Nelly has been at the forefront of the women’ s movement online since 1999 and is one of the Wall Street Journal’s “Women on the IT Fast Track”.
Nelly is a speaker and presenter for many organizations and major industries events including: Women’s Enterprise Center, New York Entrepreneurs Business Network, Small Business Summit, BlogHer, Social Media Jungle, Mom 2.0, BlogWorld, and more.
She has been featured in Inc. Magazine, NBC's Today Show, Fast Company, NewsDay.com, O’Reilly, Smart Money, Small Biz, TechRepublic, Women’s Radio and more.
Nelly can be reached at:
nelly@techspeak.co

293636693.Name: How to Cut Product Development Costs by up to 50%!
293636693.Long Description:
This event is organized by TechSpeak.
Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.
This event is FREE to attend!
In order to attend, please register here:
http://www.techspeakforentrepreneurs.com/how-to-cut-product-development-costs-by-up-to-50/?utm=ideatoipo

There is a difference between releasing code and releasing code effectively and efficiently. That difference is having an efficient process
a repeatable way to produce consistent results over and over again.
In this webinar, Nelly Yusupova, a CTO with 18 years of experience, a startup tech advisor, and the founder of TechSpeak for Entrepreneurs, will share the process she uses to manage teams and projects to deliver projects on time and on budget.
You will learn:
The lean way vs. traditional way of building products
Two money saving things you should do before you build anything
How to define your MVP properly to reduce the cost and time of development
How to see the red flags sooner and minimize mistakes
and more!

293565569.Name: Finding A Job In Germany: The Ultimate Guide for Foreigners - 30.05.2023
293565569.Tags: Web Development,Online Marketing,Startup Businesses,Unemployment Support,Education & Technology
293565569.Long Description:
Lost in the jungle of the German job market? Learn all you need to know to start working in Germany as a foreigner!
# ❓About the Event
Join us to discover the challenges of entering the labor market in Germany and how to overcome them! We will give you the best tips to navigate the bureaucratic jungle on your way to getting a secure job! 🚀
# 💫 Contents
Learn how to overcome cultural differences.
Even Germans get lost in the bureaucracy: We show you how to send applications in Germany.
Find out how to get further education for free using a Bildungsgutschein.
Our students come from very different backgrounds. 🌈 They have many different professional backgrounds, are young and old, and come from over 110 different nations. They are proof that anyone can make it in the tech industry.
Work from home, as a digital nomad or freelancer. Be valued by employers the way you deserve it.💙
We are looking forward to meeting you!
Your DCI-Team

293443694.Name: Webinar: The "Why" of Product Management by fmr Canva Product Lead
293443694.Tags: Web Development,New Product Development: Software & Tech,Product Design,Digital Marketing,Data Analytics
293443694.Long Description:
DISCLAIMER: Register here to watch the stream or access the replay
Being a Product Manager requires structured and organized thinking. Frameworks and toolkits are handy and effective ways to approach problems. Product Managers learn about many and develop their own throughout their product careers and share some of those with you today.
Main takeaways:
How to use funnel analysis to do product strategy.
Must know when conducting A/B testing.
How important it is to understand users and competitors.
Meet the Speaker: Joseph Chen
Joseph Chen is an experienced Product Leader with a decade of experience in SaaS, AI, Content Search, and Monetization. He previously worked on the number one graphic design SaaS platform, Canva as a Product Lead.
View Speaker's Full Profile
Get the FREE Product Book
Check out our curated list of free Product Management resources here
Product School is the global leader in Product Management training with a community of over one million product professionals. Our certifications are the most industry-recognized credentials by employers hiring product managers. All of our instructors are senior-level Product Managers working at top Silicon Valley companies including Google, Facebook, Netflix, Airbnb, PayPal, Uber, and Amazon.
Get Your Tickets

293587369.Name: Webinar: How to Develop AI Products by Amazon Sr Product Manager
293587369.Tags: Web Development,New Product Development: Software & Tech,Product Design,Digital Marketing,Data Analytics
293587369.Long Description:
DISCLAIMER: Register here to watch the stream or access the replay
As a Product Manager, you will be working day and night in developing the best and most impactful products. However, you must strive to avoid major pitfalls and construct the process that best suits you, but most importantly, your product.

293465281.Long Description:
## Welcome to the May 2023 edition of NewStore's TechTalks!
For this edition we bring you 2 online talks [Zoom link is available for those who RSVP]. We will start at 6pm CET.
🗓️ Agenda:
6 pm CET - "Effective Remote Work" by Carlos Rosão (Director of Engineering @ NewStore)
6.30 pm CET - "The Wastes of Product Engineering" by Luís Rodrigues (Staff Engineer @ NewStore)
🎙️ More info on the Talks and speakers:
🗓️"Effective Remote Work"
We’ve been doing remote work for a while but are we being effective while doing it?
In this presentation we will learn some tips & tricks for you and for your organization in how to setup an environment that leads to effective remote work.
🗣️ About Carlos
Carlos Rosão is currently Director of Engineering at NewStore, an enterprise omnichannel platform that is delivered as a service, providing retail businesses with a cloud-based order management system and mobile point of sale.
Carlos is passionate about growing companies, teams, people, and software and he has a demonstrated history of success in different countries, industries and contexts.
He's a firm believer and practitioner of a continuous improvement mindset and of an iterative approach towards building customer centric products.
🗓️ "The Wastes of Product Engineering"
Product engineering is wasteful, and teams often fail to realise it. Recognising how the traditional 8 wastes of Lean Manufacturing manifest themselves in software development is a key first step towards addressing them through continuous improvement, cross-functional team ownership, and agile practices.
🗣️About Luís Rodrigues
🗣️ Luís Rodrigues is currently Staff Engineer at NewStore, an enterprise omnichannel platform that is delivered as a service, providing retail businesses with a cloud-based order management system and mobile point of sale.
Luís is a software engineer with a particular interest in distributed systems, functional programming, test-driven development, web applications, and User Experience design. As a polyglot developer, he prefers to focus on first principles and technologies that responsibly address a problem and align with the team's stack.
Luís writes and delivers talks on programming, test automation, and design at multiple conferences and meetup events (see goblindegook.com/talks for a list). Outside the computer sciences, he's a freelance translator and book designer.

293352674.Name: Models of digital product development service
293352674.Tags: Outsourcing,Technology,Product Management,Digital Product Marketing,Lean Product Management
293352674.Long Description:
This panel is brought to you by Serbian Product Community in collaboration with our partner Zuhlke.
The Serbian IT market still predominantly offers software development and similar services. In the last couple of years, there's been a shift to offer customers more value by introducing another service layer and offering a service of discovering and delivering digital products.
Different companies offer different business models for that, the value they deliver through it, different ways of working, and similar but different roles that manage that kind of service.
Through this panel, we're looking to understand and look at a few of those models comparatively to better understand their similarities and differences.
Panelists:
Nikolina Belić - Principal Product Manager @Vega IT
Karatina Samardžić - Lead IT Project Manager @ Zuhlke
Dunja Stanivuković - Lead IT Project Manager @ Zuhlke
Igor Gašović - Engineering and Delivery Manager @ HTEC
Host:
Ana Pegan
Questions the panel will answer:
What services does your company offer?
What models of collaboration and payment do you use for them?
Who are the clients you work with, and who are maybe the type of clients you don't work with?
How does that collaboration look like?
What does the role that manages the service of product development look like?
How do you measure the success of the services provided?
Does your company ever get into the partnership with clients as an investor for their product?
How do you define milestones for service of product development?
What is the difference between a service of the development of project or a product?

293589696.Name: Conversion-Rate Optimierung im Produkt Management
293589696.Tags: Agile Project Management,Product Development,Product Design,Innovation,Software Development
293589696.Long Description:
Wenn Product Teams verantwortlich sind eine KPI zu treiben, entsteht schnell die Frage wie sie das denn können.
❓Welche Features sollten wir entwickeln, damit sich die Conversion Rate verbessert?
❓Sind die Features, die durch Stakeholder auf die Roadmap gewandert sind dazu geeignet, unsere KPI zu treiben?
❓Kann unser Team die Kennzahl überhaupt beeinflussen?
Frust macht sich breit, wenn sich die KPI einige Zeit lang nicht verändert. Initial wirkte es "empowerend", die Kennzahl selbst treiben zu dürfen. Mittlerweile ist das Team entmutigt und konzentriert sich lieber auf Aufgaben, bei denen es weiß, wie es sie angehen kann.
Die Kennzahl - wie zum Beispiel eine Conversion-Rate - ist nur noch Makulatur. Sie wird hin und wieder angeschaut, aber im Alltag des Teams spielt sie kaum eine Rolle.
Wir bei unserem Event "Conversion Rate Optimierung" stellen uns der Herausforderung! Wir erforschen, was Dein Produkt wirklich voranbringen kann. Statt nur den Fokus auf die Entwicklung neuer Features zu legen, eröffnen wir Dir den Blick für alternative Ansätze.
Wir leiten Dich durch effektive Discovery-Methoden und Research-Strategien, die Dein Team näher an die echten Nutzererfahrungen bringen. Dabei sammelt ihr Erkenntnisse über die echten Bedürfnisse Deiner Nutzer.
Mit diesem Wissen kannst Du gezielte Veränderungen vornehmen, die einen echten positiven Impact auf die jeweilige Conversion-Rate haben.
Melde Dich jetzt kostenlos an und sichere Dir Deinen Platz! Entdecke, was Dein Produkt wirklich voranbringt!

293492344.Name: Green Infrastructure Meetup GfK [x] Green Coding Berlin
293492344.Long Description:
Hey Green Coders!
We are partnering this month with GfK for our Meetup.
We are thrilled to announce our upcoming Green Coding and Infrastructure meet-up, which will take place on May 31st at the brand-new GfK Berlin Office. As a global player in the data insights industry, GfK is obviously keen to act and think future-oriented. Therefore, they are committed to sustainability and reducing their carbon footprint, and this event is part of GfK’s efforts to promote eco-friendliness in the tech industry.
The event is supposed to bring together like-minded professionals, developers, and enthusiasts who are passionate about green coding practices and want to make a positive impact on the environment. We will have two speaker slots for experts to share their insights, ideas, and experiences on green coding and sustainability in the tech industry.
Agenda:
18.30 – 19.00: Welcome & free Snacks & Drinks
19.00 – 19.30: Green IT and sustainability in the Cloud
19.30 – 20.00: Understanding Software Carbon emissions
As of 20.00 Q&A and Socializing
Bernhard Günther (Principal Site Reliability Engineer, GfK) will give a short presentation about Green IT and sustainability in the Cloud to feed an emerging discussion. As the cloud gives you a lot of freedom it also forces you to take the responsibility to plan your cloud infrastructure sustainable yourself.
Arne Tarara will share insights on Understanding Software Carbon emissions. Software uses no physical resources directly, but the underlying infrastructure. In order to help developers contribute to the worlds carbon neutral target it is key to understand where carbon emissions from software come from and how they can be identified. Arne, a software engineer from Open-Source company Green Coding Berlin, will give an overview over current models and frameworks for classifying and attributing software carbon share and current limitations with these approaches. He will present some Open-Source tools that make energy cost and carbon emissions visible for a developer to drive energy consumption and carbon emissions down.
In addition to the speakers, there will be enough time for networking and discussion among attendees. We encourage everyone to bring their own ideas and questions to share with the community.
We look forward to seeing you there and working together to create a more sustainable future through green coding and infrastructure practices!
